0.title: Floods triggered by seasonal rains leave 50 dead in Sudan: Official
0.article_body: Floods triggered by seasonal rainfall have left over 50 people dead and inundated over 8,170 homes in Sudan, a senior police official said on Saturday. Sudan's National Council for Civil Defense spokesperson said that about 25 people were also injured so far this year, SUNA news agency reported. About 540 feddans (acres) of agricultural land was damaged, the spokesperson added.

1.title: Rohit backed Avesh even after four failures and the pacer delivered: Parthiv
1.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel has said India captain Rohit Sharma stands out in backing players who sometimes don't perform. "Rohit is vocal about them even in public and in press conferences...as we saw with the case of Avesh Khan. Rohit backed him even after four failures [during India's tour of WI] and [Avesh] delivered with a Man-of-the-Match performance," stated Parthiv.

2.title: Ukraine targeting Russians shooting at or from nuclear plant: Zelenskyy
2.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian soldiers who either shoot at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, or shoot using it as cover become a special target for Ukraine's intelligence agents. Ukraine accused Russia of hitting part of the plant which generates power for the southern Ukraine. The two sides have accused each other of carrying out shelling at the nuclear facility.

3.title: Salman Rushdie's stab wounds listed in court after attack on him in New York
3.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie suffered three stab wounds to the right side of the front of his neck, four stab wounds to his stomach, a puncture wound to his right eye and chest, and a laceration on his right thigh, according to the Chautauqua County District attorney. Rushdie was attacked in New York on Friday, after which he underwent a surgery.

4.title: Billionaire investor Jhunjhunwala began trading with ₹5,000 during his college days
4.article_body: Late veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala began trading when he was in college in 1985 with a sum of ₹5,000. While his father, who was an official in the Income Tax Department, told him not to ask him for money, Jhunjhunwala borrowed money from his brother's clients while promising them higher returns. His net worth later grew to $5 billion.

5.title: China to reopen Shanghai schools from Sept 1 with daily COVID testing
5.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai will reopen kindergartens, nurseries, primary, middle and high schools, which had been shut since mid-March due to the spread of COVID-19, on September 1. All teachers and students in the city will have to take nucleic acid tests every day before leaving campus. Shanghai, China's most populous city, reported five new local asymptomatic cases on Saturday.

6.title: What were the top holdings of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala?
6.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62 on Sunday, held a 4% stake in Titan Company worth ₹8,728 crore, making it his top holding in terms of value. Jhunjhunwala's major holdings include Star Health & Allied Insurance, Tata Motors, Fortis Healthcare and CRISIL, Moneycontrol reported. Jhunjhunwala had a net worth of more than ₹46,000 crore, as per Forbes.

7.title: Search operation on to trace 3 missing people in UP’s Banda
7.article_body: Rescue and search operation is on for three missing people in UP’s Banda district where a boat capsized on August 11. A total of 12 bodies have been recovered so far. “NDRF, SDRF and police teams are carrying out rescue operations...The flow in the river is high which is creating problems in the operation,” Banda SP Abhinandan said.

8.title: Man fires shots at Canberra Airport in Australia, arrested
8.article_body: Australia's Canberra Airport was evacuated after a man fired shots on the premises on Sunday, the police said. The man has been taken into custody and the firearm has been recovered, the police added. "CCTV has been reviewed and at this time the person in custody is believed to be the only person responsible," the police further said.

9.title: 'Laal...' deserves to succeed, maybe bit too overstated emotionally: Hansal
9.article_body: On Twitter, filmmaker Hansal Mehta wrote that Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' deserves to succeed. "It's a very engaging film made with passion...love. Maybe a bit too overstated emotionally...a bit superficial politically for my taste but a film made with so much care, heart...honesty," he added. Hansal said he found himself moist-eyed or smiling for a major part of it.

10.title: Tata Tea Premium unveils #DeshKaGarv collection on 75th Independence Day
10.article_body: This Independence Day, Tata Tea Premium in collaboration with The Plated Project presents limited-edition #DeshKaGarv Art collection. With this, the brand aims to commemorate events from India’s past that contributed to her pride & glory globally. All proceeds from the collection purchased will be donated to sponsor meals for underprivileged children, enabling them to build a better future.

11.title: Never wanted the world to find out this way I called you Bhaiyya: Smriti on Jhunjhunwala
11.article_body: After billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's demise, Union Minister Smriti Irani wrote, "I never wanted the world to find out this way that I love you and called you Bhaiyya." "Since the day I was married, you never made me feel that I am to be treated like a daughter in law...I don't want to say goodbye," she added.

12.title: Info Edge invests ₹300 crore in its subsidiary Startup Investments
12.article_body: Noida-based IT firm Info Edge invested ₹300 crore in its fully-owned subsidiary Startup Investments (Holding) Limited (SIHL), the firm said in a regulatory filing. The capital will be used to explore other investment opportunities like contribution towards alternative investment funds (AIFs) managed by Info Edge-owned Smartweb Internet Services. Info Edge owns portals like Naukri and 99acres.

13.title: India has the 3rd largest startup ecosystem: Jitendra Singh
13.article_body: Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh said that India has the third largest startup ecosystem and the third highest number of unicorns. While delivering a keynote address, Singh mentioned that this decade is expected to bring transformational changes for Indian science, technology and innovation (STI). He also said that over 49% startups are from tier two and three cities.

14.title: 21-year-old youth booked after minor ends life in Ambala
14.article_body: Police arrested a 21-year-old college student in Ambala on charges of abetment to suicide after a 17-year-old girl died allegedly after consuming some poisonous substance. The deceased girl’s father, in his complaint, told the police that the youth and his daughter were in a relationship. He had promised to marry the girl but later backtracked, the complainant added.

15.title: Mumbai Police destroys 151 high-volume modified silencers of 2-wheelers
15.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Traffic Police crushed 151 seized modified high-volume silencers of two-wheelers with a road roller. Police said that modifying silencers with high volume is not permitted and many bikers install it for thrill. Strict action will also be taken against garage owners who install such silencers, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Purushottam Karad said.

16.title: After tremendous pressure, RSS finally changes profile pics to Tiranga: Khera
16.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera commented on RSS changing the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour. "After tremendous pressure for a week, a sheepish RSS finally changes profile pictures to Tiranga," Khera tweeted. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile picture to the national flag.

17.title: J'khand judge's murder shook judiciary, citizens; led to fear: Court
17.article_body: In the sentencing order regarding Judge Uttam Anand's murder in Jharkhand's Dhanbad, Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) Rajni Kant Pathak said that the incident shook the judicial fraternity and the citizens. "After the incident, there was an atmosphere of fear among the family members of judicial officers and the people of the country," the order said.

18.title: What an absolute blast: 'Baby Driver' director on Rajamouli's 'RRR'
18.article_body: 'Baby Driver' director Edgar Wright praised SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' on Twitter. "Finally saw 'RRR' on the big screen at the BFI with a great crowd. What an absolute blast. So entertaining," he tweeted. He further wrote, "The only film I've ever seen where the intermission card itself got a round of applause." The film featured Jr NTR and Ram Charan.

19.title: Rushdie's attacker pleads not guilty, his lawyer says 'People need to keep an open mind'
19.article_body: The man accused of stabbing author Salman Rushdie has pleaded not guilty to charges of attempted murder and assault. The 24-year-old accused Hadi Matar's lawyer said, "I think the important thing to remember is people need to keep an open mind. They need to look at everything. They can't just assume something happened for why they think something happened."

20.title: Pluses & minuses aside, 'Laal Singh...' is magnificent: Hrithik Roshan
20.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Hrithik Roshan praised Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and wrote, "I felt the heart of this movie." "Just watched 'Laal Singh Chaddha'...Pluses and minuses aside, this movie is just magnificent," he further added. Calling 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a "gem", Hrithik urged people to watch the film. The film, directed by Advait Chandan, also features Kareena Kapoor.

21.title: US man drinks liquid in court during child sexual assault conviction, dies
21.article_body: A 57-year-old man died after he drank a bottle of liquid, which appeared to be cloudy, while being convicted of child abuse in court in US' Texas. The defence lawyer said that man started vomiting shortly after entering the holding cell, following which emergency services were called. The man's hand was "shaking", but he kept drinking, the defence lawyer added.

22.title: Man slits wife's throat inside family court after deciding to reunite in Karnataka
22.article_body: A man has been arrested in Karnataka's Hassan for allegedly killing his wife by slitting her throat inside a family court, where they had come for counselling after filing for divorce, police said. The accused had agreed to reunite with her during the counselling and attacked her in the court's restroom. He tried to escape but was caught by people.

23.title: My intent was not to victimise myself: CEO who posted crying selfie after firing staff
23.article_body: US-based HyperSocial’s CEO Braden Wallake, who posted a photo of himself crying on LinkedIn after firing employees, shared another post following criticism. He wrote, "I'm the crying CEO. No, my intent was not to make it about me or victimise myself. I'm sorry it came across that way. It wasn't my place to out the employees' names publicly."

24.title: Akasa Air issues statement after Jhunjhunwala's death, says 'Will honour his legacy'
24.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Sunday issued a statement after the death of the veteran investor. It said, "We are deeply saddened by the untimely demise of Mr Jhunjhunwala…We cannot thank [him] enough for...putting his trust...in us to build a world-class airline. [He] had an invincible spirit...Akasa Air will honour [his] legacy, values and belief in us".

25.title: Such pettiness: Congress to CM Bommai for 'Har Ghar...' ad without Nehru
25.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Karnataka CM BS Bommai insulted his father SR Bommai and his father's first political guru MN Roy, who were great Nehru admirers, by excluding Jawaharlal Nehru's photo from 'Har Ghar Tiranga' newspaper ad. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Nehru will survive such pettiness. CM Karnataka desperate to save his job...Pathetic this is."

26.title: It was shocking for me: Aakash on Chahal missing T20 WC last year
26.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said that he was "shocked" when Yuzvendra Chahal was not named in India's squad for the T20 World Cup last year. Aakash added that the 32-year-old is "definitely going to Australia" for the upcoming T20 World Cup. He further said, "Chahal is the number one genuine wicket-taker that [we] have."

27.title: Scindia to celebrate ‘Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav’ in Gwalior
27.article_body: As part of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia will inaugurate photo exhibition and preside over various programmes at Maharani Lakshmi Bai Ki Chhatri and Central Jail in Gwalior today. He will also observe ‘Partition Horrors Remembrance Day’ to remind the nation of the sacrifices made by Indians during the partition in 1947.

28.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala died of cardiac arrest, was suffering from multiple ailments
28.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala passed away at the age of 62 after suffering a cardiac arrest, as per the death certificate issued. Notably, Jhunjhunwala had been suffering from multiple ailments, including kidney disease and ischemic heart disease and was brought dead to Breach Candy Hospital around 6.45 am on Sunday. He will be cremated today evening in Mumbai.

29.title: Ram Janmbhoomi temple hoists national flag in Ayodhya
29.article_body: As part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, the national flag was hoisted at the Ram Janmbhoomi temple complex in Ayodhya. Participating in this campaign were the officers and staff of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra trust, including the construction workers. The campaign aims to encourage people to hoist the flag to mark the 75th year of India’s independence.

30.title: Police taser parents trying to enter school under lockdown in US
30.article_body: The police arrested three parents and tasered two of them after they tried to enter a school in US' Arizona, which was under lockdown following reports of a male suspect carrying a handgun attempting to get on campus. The incident occurred as parents tried to forcefully enter the buildings, police said. The suspect has been taken into custody, police added.

31.title: Jhunjhunwala symbol of entrepreneurial spirit, will be remembered for Akasa Air: Scindia
31.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia on Sunday said that billionaire investor and Akasa Air co-founder Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was a symbol of India's entrepreneurial spirit and will remain an inspiration for the youth of the country. Scindia added, "He will be remembered for giving India its new airline Akasa Air after more than a decade."

32.title: You have to give Dhawan importance: Karim on captaincy change
32.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul replacing Shikhar Dhawan as India captain for the ODI series against Zimbabwe, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said, "You have to give Dhawan importance once you make the announcement as captain." He added, "Rahul should have played the series only as a member." Dhawan, who was initially named captain, has been named Rahul's deputy for the series.

33.title: Jhunjhunwala was my school mate, believed stock India was undervalued: Kotak
33.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak expressed his condolences after the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Kotak said Jhunjhunwala was his school and college mate and a year junior to him. "[He] believed stock India was undervalued. He was right. Amazingly sharp in understanding financial markets," Kotak tweeted. Both Kotak and Jhunjhunwala graduated from Mumbai's Sydenham College.

34.title: Kalam's dream of India becoming superpower to be realised by 2047: Union Minister
34.article_body: Union Minister L Murugan on Saturday said that under PM Narendra Modi's governance, the country is moving towards the path of becoming a superpower in the global arena. "The dream of former President APJ Abdul Kalam [of] making India a superpower would be realised by 2047 when the country celebrates its 100th year of independence," Murugan added.

35.title: Varun Dhawan meets Indian cricket team, says 'Was like boy in candy shop'
35.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan met the Indian cricket team at the Mumbai airport. Varun took to Twitter and shared pictures with the team. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "At four in the morning, I was like a boy in a candy shop. Got very excited to meet and chat with our men in blue about their upcoming tour," Varun tweeted.

36.title: Rajasthan CM assures speedy probe after Dalit boy's death, announces ₹5 lakh for family
36.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was beaten to death by his teacher for drinking water from his pot in Rajasthan's Jalore, state Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that justice will be ensured to the family of the victim at the earliest. The Chief Minister added that an assistance amount of ₹5 lakh will be given to the family of deceased.

37.title: IAS officer shares pic of Tricolour face masks, says 'please don't buy such masks'
37.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a picture of face masks made out of the Tricolour. "Please do not make, buy or use such masks," he wrote. Several Twitter users criticised such masks, with one saying, "It's better to find out makers of this mask & launch FIR for disrespect of our flag."

38.title: Want to do roles that aren't me like Rani Bharti of 'Maharani': Huma
38.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, speaking about the current phase of her acting career after featuring in the 'Maharani' series, said she's having fun. "Being a hardcore Delhi girl, I have certain life...experiences but I want to do roles that aren't me such as Rani Bharti of 'Maharani'," she added. She stated she is "nowhere" close to Rani Bharti in real life.

39.title: He was an institution by himself: K'taka CM pays tribute to Jhunjhunwala
39.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai took to social media to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. "Shocked and saddened by the untimely demise of ace stock trader and investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala this morning. A role model for many young investors, he was an institution by himself. May his soul rest in peace," he tweeted.

40.title: Breaks my heart to know my friend is no more: Vedanta chief on Jhunjhunwala's death
40.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday tweeted a photo of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala while condoling his death. Agarwal wrote, "Breaks my heart to know that a friend of mine, and more widely known as the big bull of our stock market, is no more…Rakesh Jhunjhunwala will forever be known as the man who popularised public understanding of stock markets."

41.title: Let's see film on Poo someday, she's relevant with this generation: Kareena
41.article_body: Kareena Kapoor has said her 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' character Poo is relevant to the current generation. "The way she is, the way she talks, the kind of millennial Gen-Z kind of words that she uses connect somehow...Let's see a film someday, who knows," she added. 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' was directed by Karan Johar and featured Shah Rukh Khan.

42.title: SP's Maurya sends ₹11.50 cr defamation notice to Noida Police chief
42.article_body: SP leader Swami Prasad Maurya claimed to have sent a defamation notice to GB Nagar Police Commissioner for linking him to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting and abusing a woman in Noida. Maurya has sought ₹11.50 crore as general and special compensation for loss of reputation and family honour, mental torture and physical agony.

43.title: Kamath posts pic with Jhunjhunwala, says 'There'll never be someone like you'
43.article_body: Stockbroking platform Zerodha's Co-founder Nikhil Kamath condoled the demise of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away aged 62. Sharing a picture with him on Twitter, Kamath wrote, "There will never again be someone like you, RIP." Jhunjhunwala, who was reportedly suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, was brought dead to Mumbai's Breach Candy Hospital on Sunday morning.

44.title: 9-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death by teacher for drinking water from his pot in Raj
44.article_body: A nine-year-old Dalit boy in Rajasthan's Jalore district died on Saturday after he was allegedly beaten by his school teacher for drinking water from his pot. "My son didn't know that the pot was meant for [teacher Chail] Singh, who belongs to an upper caste," the boy's father said. A case has been registered under SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

45.title: Investor, risk taker & a leader in his own right: Sitharaman on Jhunjhunwala's death
45.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman took to Twitter to condole the death of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. She tweeted, "Shri Rakesh Jhunjhunwala is no more. Investor, bold risk taker, masterly understanding of the stock market, clear in communication- a leader in his own right. Fondly remember several conversations we had. Had strong belief in India's strength and capabilities."

46.title: Jhunjhunwala inspired investors, he will be remembered for his bullish outlook: Shah
46.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday tweeted, "Anguished to learn about the passing away of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala Ji. His vast experience and understanding of the stock market have inspired countless investors." The minister added, "He will always be remembered for his bullish outlook. My deepest condolences to his family. Om Shanti Shanti."

47.title: Security in place for flag hoisting at Idgah Maidan: Bengaluru Police
47.article_body: After Karnataka government asked police to hoist national flag at Idgah Maidan, the Bengaluru Police Commissioner said that all security arrangements have been made for Independence Day celebration and if situation demands, additional forces will be deployed. "We have deployed a KSRP battalion, a police inspector and 10 police constables," Additional Commissioner of Police Sandeep Patil said.

48.title: Adani condoles Jhunjhunwala's death, calls him India's 'most legendary investor'
48.article_body: Asia's richest man and Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani condoled the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. Adani tweeted, "Extremely saddened by the untimely passing away of the most legendary investor that India has had. Shri Jhunjhunwala inspired an entire generation to believe in our equity markets with his brilliant views." Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

49.title: 15 people injured after car crashes into a pub in US' Virginia
49.article_body: Nine people were taken to hospitals and six others were treated on the scene after a car crashed into a pub in Arlington in US' Virginia, according to authorities. The crash also caused a fire to break out, which was quickly extinguished by the fire department, police said. Two of the injured people are in critical condition, the police added.

50.title: People live on roadside in Delhi as Yamuna water enters low-lying areas
50.article_body: Several people resorted to living on the roadside in Delhi after overflowing water from the Yamuna river inundated low-lying areas, news agency ANI reported. Reports said that low-lying areas near Mayur Vihar Phase I and Akshardham Temple were flooded due to the overflowing Yamuna river. "The water came gushing in...I immediately rushed to evacuate my family members," a woman said.

51.title: End of an era as the 'Big Bull of the Dalal Street' passes away: Virender Sehwag
51.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to condole the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala. He tweeted, "End of an era as the Big Bull of the Dalal Street passes away. Condolences to his family and loved ones. Om Shanti." Jhunjhunwala, who was suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, passed away aged 62 on Sunday.

52.title: Nitish's growing national ambition reason why he broke ties with BJP: Sushil Modi
52.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi commented on JD(U) breaking its alliance with BJP in Bihar, saying that the real reason behind this was Bihar CM Nitish Kumar’s "failing popularity, growing national ambition and a desire to gain political strength". Sushil Modi told The Print, "Nitish calculated...allying with RJD would give him more seats in LS and Assembly elections...thus protect his turf."

53.title: Those who made threat calls to MLAs were in touch with Pak handlers: Haryana Police
53.article_body: Haryana Police have said that accused who made death threat calls to some of the MLAs were in touch with their handlers in Pakistan. The investigators have also found that the accused had allegedly transacted ₹2.7 crore through 727 bank accounts in last eight months. Police have found 18 virtual numbers operating from abroad in phones of six arrested men.

54.title: 8 Israelis injured in shooting near Jerusalem's Old City
54.article_body: A gunman opened fire at a bus parked near the Western Wall near Jerusalem's Old City. The suspected Palestinian attack left eight Israelis injured including two who are critical. Israeli police searched for the attacker in the nearby Palestinian neighbourhood of Silwan. The attack comes after a week of clashes between Israelis and Palestinians in Gaza and West Bank.

55.title: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was brought dead to the hospital: Breach Candy CEO
55.article_body: Veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday morning, was brought dead to the Mumbai hospital, Breach Candy Hospital CEO N Santhanam told The Indian Express. Jhunjhunwala was suffering from diabetes and a kidney ailment, a doctor said. As per reports, he was admitted to the hospital a few days ago and later discharged.

56.title: Will not let honour of India get sacrificed: Rajnath Singh
56.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticised the Opposition for politicising border security with China. “Those who raise questions against the national security, I as the Defence Minister, want to assure them that no matter how hard it gets I will not let the honour of India get sacrificed. Due to PM Modi, India’s security...has become stronger than ever,” said Singh.

57.title: Markets will grow at a slower pace: Jhunjhunwala in last interview before his death
57.article_body: In his last interview before his death, billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala remarked that the Indian "markets will grow at a slower pace regardless of global developments". In a video of his remarks, he added, "I think Indian markets will gain but they will gain at a slower pace." Jhunjhunwala passed away at the age of 62 on Sunday in Mumbai.

58.title: Congress leader Deepender Hooda tests COVID positive
58.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda has tested COVID-19 positive for the second time in a year. “After experiencing symptoms, I got myself tested and my COVID report is positive. With the advice of doctors, I am isolating myself and starting the related treatment. Because of this, I have to stay away from next few programs,” said Hooda.

59.title: N Korea criticises UN chief for supporting its denuclearisation
59.article_body: North Korea criticised UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres for supporting full denuclearisation of North Korea, saying remarks lack impartiality and fairness. "Complete, verifiable and irreversible denuclearisation was an infringement upon sovereignty of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea," North Korea added. Seoul and Washington suspect North Korea is preparing to test a nuclear weapon.

60.title: India reports 14,092 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate stands at 3.69%
60.article_body: India has reported 14,092 new COVID-19 cases and 41 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 12 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,16,861, while the daily positivity rate stood at 3.69%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,27,037.

61.title: When the PM speaks with us, it feels like the country is supporting: Harmanpreet
61.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, has said it's important to receive motivation from the country's PM. She added, "When PM Modi speaks with us, it feels like the entire country is supporting us and that everybody is appreciating our hard work." PM Modi met with athletes who participated in the 2022 CWG.

62.title: 13 Chinese planes crossed Taiwan Strait's median line: Taiwan
62.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry has said that 13 Chinese air force planes had crossed Taiwan Strait's median line on Saturday. This comes as the country's Foreign Ministry thanked the US for taking "concrete actions" to maintain security and peace in the region the same day. China had launched military drills around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit.

63.title: PM Modi condoles Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's demise, says 'he was full of life, witty'
63.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and wrote, "Rakesh Jhunjhunwala was indomitable. Full of life, witty and insightful, he leaves behind an indelible contribution to the financial world." "He was also very passionate about India's progress. His passing away is saddening," he added. Widely known as the 'Big Bull', Jhunjhunwala passed away aged 62.

64.title: Big B used to meet me after shoot, call me for his Diwali parties: Pavail
64.article_body: Actor Pavail Gulati said that actor Amitabh Bachchan is "a very special person". "He was very kind to me while we were shooting 'Yudh'. Even after shoot, he used to meet me and call me for his Diwali parties. He is an extremely genuine host," Pavail said, adding that it is fun being around him and his energy is infectious.

65.title: BJP rattled by developments in Bihar, state taught them lesson: Akhilesh
65.article_body: Following the recent political change in Bihar, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said BJP is "rattled" by the developments there. "Bihar has taught them a lesson," Yadav added. The Hindustan Times reported that on being asked, "How will Bihar impact the Opposition politics?" Yadav said, "Bihar has also sent a message to the Opposition, the message of alliance and cohesiveness."

66.title: Extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
66.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted extremely heavy rainfall in Odisha, east Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh on August 14 and in central Maharashtra and west Madhya Pradesh on August 15. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Goa and Gujarat between August 14 and 16.

67.title: Sara Ali Khan will do 2 films with me, we're excited: Karan Johar
67.article_body: Filmmaker-producer Karan Johar has said that actress Sara Ali Khan will be doing two films that will be produced by Karan's Dharma Productions. "Sara is going to do an amazing film with me, which I'm producing...we are very excited. And there's one more film that she will do for us, for which I'm also very excited," he stated.

68.title: Over 15,000 potholes repaired in past 30 days in Mumbai: BMC
68.article_body: More than 15,000 potholes have been patched and 22,988 road craters have been filled in Mumbai in the last 30 days, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. Andheri West area remains the most-affected from potholes as 1,667 of them alone were found in western suburbs. Recently, BMC invited tenders worth ₹7 crore to repair cratered roads with better techniques.

69.title: Shiv Sangram chief Vinayak Mete dies in car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway
69.article_body: Shiv Sangram chief Vinayak Mete was killed after his car met with an accident on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near Khopoli on Sunday, Raigad district collector Mahendra Kalyankar said. Reports said that Mete was admitted to MGM Hospital in Kamothe. Police said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck when the accident took place.

70.title: Wanted to substitute entire team: Ten Hag on Man Utd's 4-0 loss vs Brentford
70.article_body: After Manchester United's second straight defeat in the Premier League season, manager Erik ten Hag said he wanted to substitute his entire team at half-time against Brentford. Manchester United conceded four goals in the first 35 minutes to suffer a 4-0 defeat in the game. "I think we all have seen the game...Brentford was more hungry," added Ten Hag.

71.title: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala passes away aged 62
71.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who was widely known as 'India's Warren Buffett' and the 'Big Bull', has passed away at the age of 62. Jhunjhunwala had recently attended the launch of commercial operations of Akasa Air on August 7, an airline co-founded by him and former Jet Airways CEO Vinay Dube.

72.title: 1st batch of explosives reach site ahead of Noida's twin towers' demolition
72.article_body: Ahead of the demolition of twin towers in Noida, the first batch of explosives have reached the site. Reports said that more than 3,500 kg of explosives will be filled in around 9,400 holes drilled in columns and shears of the skeletal structures of the twin towers for the demolition. Officials said the charging process will take around 15 days.

73.title: We are in a good space now: Raqesh Bapat on his break-up with Shamita
73.article_body: Actor Raqesh Bapat, speaking about his music video with his ex-girlfriend Shamita Shetty, has said, "I think it is mutual respect. We are in a good space now." He added it's important for them to concentrate on their respective careers. "We...are in a space where we're fortunate to have gone through...many experiences and...we have dealt with it," he added.

74.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyderabad for Independence Day celebration
74.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued an advisory for 75th Independence Day celebration at Rani Mahal lawns in Golconda on Monday. As per the advisory, the route from Ramdev Guda to Golconda Fort will be blocked for all ordinary vehicular traffic as part of the detours and the traffic restrictions will be enforced between 7 am and 12 noon.

75.title: Some people think Shiv Sena is object lying in open: Uddhav Thackeray
75.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said some people think Shiv Sena is an object lying in the open which they can pick it up and take it away. Shiv Sena's foundations are "deep-rooted and strong" and no one can stake claim over the party, he added. Thackeray was addressing the 62nd foundation day of Shiv Sena's weekly 'Marmik'.

76.title: Understand fiscal strength of your state before promising something for free: Sitharaman
76.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has asked the states giving 'freebies' to check the fiscal strength of the state government and make budgetary provision accordingly. She said, "Do it but make sure you understand the financial level of your state, the fiscal strength of your state...making sure that your budget will have a provision for it," she said.

77.title: Coaching teacher kidnaps Maha girl, police rescues her within 12 hrs
77.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was rescued by the police from a remote farmhouse in Maharashtra's Palghar within 12 hours of her being missing. Reports said that the girl was allegedly kidnapped by a coaching class teacher who was reportedly upset about withdrawal of girl's enrolment from his class. The teacher kidnapped the girl when she was returning from school.

78.title: There will be blood on the streets: Google executives reportedly warn staff about layoffs
78.article_body: Google executives reportedly warned staff about layoffs in case of poor results. Employees at the Google Cloud sales department said the senior leadership told them that there will be an "overall examination of sales productivity and productivity in general." If third-quarter results "don’t look up, [then] there will be blood on the streets," according to a message conveyed to them.

79.title: Joe Biden issues statement on attack on Salman Rushdie, says 'Shocked and saddened'
79.article_body: US President Joe Biden has issued a statement on the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "Jill and I were shocked and saddened to learn of the vicious attack on Salman Rushdie," he wrote. "Salman Rushdie—with his insight into humanity, with his unmatched sense for story, with his refusal to be intimidated or silenced—stands for essential, universal ideals," he added.

80.title: 700-year-old handmade paper made in 1320 restored by Pune institute
80.article_body: Pune's Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute has restored a 700-year-old paper made in 1320. Officials said that this is the oldest paper in Maharashtra. "This is a handmade paper made up of a bulk of tress. It has withstood any corrupt microbiological elements and we intend to keep it that way by preserving it," the chairman of the institute said.

81.title: Bradman averaged 101.39 before last Test, ended with 99.94 after getting out on a duck
81.article_body: Legendary Australian batter Donald Bradman had scored 6,996 Test runs at an average of 101.39 as he came out to bat for the last time on August 14, 1948. Bradman was bowled for a duck by a googly from England's Eric Hollies in his last innings and finished four short of 7,000 runs, and with a record average of 99.94.

82.title: I see a lot of hate, don't know why people get annoyed: Karan on love for Alia
82.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that he sees a lot of hate for the relationship that he shares with actress Alia Bhatt. "I don't know why people get so annoyed. I'm allowed to love somebody from my heart," Karan said, adding, "She's the first person I felt like I had a parental instinct for."

83.title: Kiara says she met Sidharth 5 years ago, heard about Shershaah at a party
83.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said that she met actor Sidharth Malhotra at a party five years ago. She also said that she heard about the movie 'Shershaah' at the party and was cast for the role of 'Dimple' opposite Sidharth years later. As 'Shershaah' completed one year, they also recalled how Sidharth forced Kiara to cheat on her diet during shoot.

84.title: You can't ignore this: Aanand on 'Raksha...' being called regressive
84.article_body: Reacting to his film 'Raksha Bandhan' being called regressive, director Aanand L Rai said, "You can't ignore this...there are many things that need to be taken care of...you can't shut your eyes off." He added if the audience finds that there is something regressive about the Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan', that means there is time to correct the society.

85.title: Author Salman Rushdie taken off ventilator, able to talk: Agent
85.article_body: Salman Rushdie was taken off ventilator and able to talk on Saturday, his agent confirmed after the author was stabbed on stage in New York. Fellow author Aatish Taseer had earlier tweeted that Rushdie was "off the ventilator and talking (and joking)". His attacker has been identified as Hadi Matar.

86.title: B'luru tutor beats 15-yr-old boy with iron pipe, injures his head; held
86.article_body: A tutor recently injured a Class 10 student's head after beating him with an iron pipe at a coaching centre near Bengaluru's Yelahanka. The tutor, Vijay Kumar, was arrested following a complaint by the 15-year-old boy's parents. Kumar said he wanted to threaten some boys over their "arrogant" reply by swaying an iron rod and never intended to beat them.

87.title: Sachin Tendulkar scored 1st of his 100 international hundreds as a 17-year-old
87.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar scored his maiden international hundred at the age of 17 years and 112 days on August 14, 1990, in a Test against England at Old Trafford. Playing in his ninth Test, Sachin scored 119*(189) in the second innings to help India draw the match. Sachin is the third youngest player to score a Test ton.

88.title: PSG set to offer Man Utd's Marcus Rashford long-term contract: Reports
88.article_body: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is set to be offered a long-term contract by Paris Saint-Germain, reports said. PSG manager Christopher Galtier is looking to pair Rashford with Kylian Mbappe in a two-man attack, reports added. Reports had earlier claimed there were "positive discussions" between the player and the Parisian football club regarding a transfer.

89.title: Tropical Storm Meari brings heavy rains in Japan
89.article_body: Tropical Storm Meari, with wind speeds of 72 km/h, brought heavy rains to Japan's Honshu island on Saturday as it moved northward towards the capital Tokyo. Over 72,000 people in the island's main city were asked to evacuate due to possible landslides. The storm is expected to move northward and then eastward into the Pacific Ocean by early Sunday.

90.title: Violence not a response to words: UN chief on Rushdie stabbing
90.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was "appalled" to learn about the attack on author Salman Rushdie, saying 'violence cannot be a response to words'. Rushdie was stabbed by a 24-year-old man in New York on Friday. "In no case is violence a response to words...written by others in their exercise of the freedoms of opinion and expression," Guterres said.

91.title: Himachal Pradesh records 423 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
91.article_body: Himachal Pradesh on Saturday reported 423 fresh cases of COVID-19, officials said, taking the state's active case count to 3,024. One death due to the infection was recorded in Sirmaur district. The state's death toll due to COVID-19 reached 4,163. On Friday, Himachal Pradesh had logged 443 cases of the infection and one fatality.

92.title: Army, NDRF teams reach MP's Dhar district after dam breached
92.article_body: The Army and National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel reached Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Saturday after an under-construction dam on the Karam river was breached. The government said water from the reservoir was being safely drained out to reduce pressure on its wall. People from 18 downstream villages have been preemptively shifted to safer areas.

93.title: Doctors conduct health check-up of jailed former WB minister
93.article_body: A team of eight doctors from state-run SSKM Hospital conducted a health check-up of jailed former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee at the Presidency Correctional Home in Kolkata on Saturday, an official said. The suspended Trinamool Congress leader had complained of back and leg pain. Chatterjee was prescribed exercises and a specific diet to control blood sugar, the official said.

94.title: Delhi reports 2,031 fresh COVID-19 cases, 9 deaths
94.article_body: Delhi logged 2,031 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday with a positivity rate of 12.34%, as per data shared by the health department. The city's single-day caseload remained above 2,000 for the 11th consecutive day. The national capital also recorded nine fatalities due to the infection. On Friday, Delhi had reported 10 deaths due to COVID-19, the highest in six months.

95.title: Number of Congress ministerial berth in Bihar finalised: AICC
95.article_body: Bihar in-charge of All India Congress Committee (AICC) Bhakta Charan Das on Saturday said that the number of ministerial berths Congress would get in Bihar's Mahagathbandhan government has been finalised. "The number would be [respectable and] as per our strength in the House. We've not yet finalised the names," he added. He said oath-taking is likely to happen on Tuesday.

96.title: UK minister switches sides to back Liz Truss in race for new PM
96.article_body: UK Cabinet Minister Robert Buckland who backed Rishi Sunak in the race to become Britain's next Prime Minister until recently, on Saturday switched sides to rival candidate Liz Truss' camp. Buckland said now he believes Truss is the "right person to take the country forward". He said Truss' plans are more suited to help the UK attain a "high-productivity economy".

97.title: Police arrest main accused behind dumping of meat at temple in UP
97.article_body: The main accused in the last month's meat dumping incident at a temple in Kannauj's Talgram town in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested, police said. The accused, Mansoor, is a butcher and was hired by a local, Chanchal Tripathi, to throw the meat as the latter aimed at getting the local SHO transferred. So far, 17 people have been arrested.

98.title: Video shows T'gana minister opening fire at Tiranga rally, says 'fired rubber bullet'
98.article_body: A video showing Telangana Prohibition and Excise Minister Srinivas Goud opening fire into the air from a gun at a Tiranga rally on Saturday has gone viral. The Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader allegedly opened fire from a loaded police gun, ANI reported. Dismissing the allegation, Goud said he had fired a rubber bullet. The incident reportedly happened in Mahabubnagar.

99.title: CCI approves merger of HDFC Bank and HDFC
99.article_body: The CCI has approved the proposal of merger of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) and HDFC Bank. The board of HDFC had approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank in April this year. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank.

100.title: The worst Olympic federation is better than AIFF: Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal
100.article_body: Talking about the current state of All India Football Federation (AIFF), which doesn't have an elected body and is run by an SC-appointed CoA, Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal said, "What's happening on the AIFF side is extremely tragic." "I can tell you for a fact that the worst Olympic federation is better than the AIFF," he added.

101.title: Acting is a tiring job, takes an emotional toll on you: Manoj Bajpayee
101.article_body: National Award-winning actor Manoj Bajpayee in an interview called acting a "tiring job". The actor, who has been shooting continuously for various projects in the past few months, added, "You've to play various characters who've their own emotions and I've always believed in giving my best, so it takes an emotional toll which takes...long time to come out of it."

102.title: What is true is true: Johar on revealing Sara and Kartik's relationship
102.article_body: Karan Johar has responded after being accused of sharing personal details about celebrities' relationships on his talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. Johar, who confirmed Sara Ali Khan and Kartik Aaryan's relationship in one of the episodes, said, "Everyone knows about these relationships. I'm not making anything up." "What's true is true and I suppose everyone's okay with it," he added.

103.title: Germany urges businesses to curb heating to reduce gas consumption
103.article_body: Germany's Economy Minister on Saturday said that German businesses and public institutions should heat their offices no higher than 19 degrees Celsius this winter to help reduce consumption of natural gas. Germany aims to reduce its dependence on gas from Russia in response to the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Germany has also imposed sanctions on Russia due to the invasion.

104.title: 24-hour rail strike to hit holidayers and football fans in UK
104.article_body: Thousands of UK train drivers went on a 24-hour strike on Saturday, protesting against proposed job cuts and demanding better pay and working conditions. Many British rail companies are considering employment cuts as the country experienced a 40-year-high rate of inflation this year. The strike is set to disturb the plans of holidayers and football fans going to stadiums.

105.title: VLC Media Player website & download link blocked in India
105.article_body: The website of VLC Media Player, one of the most popular media players across multiple platforms, has been blocked by the government in India. Users are unable to download the program's exe file for installation from the website videolan.org. However, the media player's Android app is still available on Google Play Store and already-installed players are also working, reports said.

106.title: India didn't let China intrude into its territory: Rajnath Singh
106.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said that India did not let Chinese forces trespass on its territory. "Many incidents happened in this matter, which only we two-three people know," Rajnath stated. "I cannot divulge those details," he added. The Defence Minister further urged political parties not to politicise issues related to national security.

107.title: Saumya Tandon urges fans to donate for Deepesh Bhan's family to repay ₹50 lakh home loan
107.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actress Saumya Tandon launched an initiative to help late actor Deepesh Bhan's family. She requested people to donate and help Deepesh's family repay a home loan worth ₹50 lakh. "He...often used to talk about his home...Now, we can repay him by giving back his house to his son," said Saumya.

108.title: When I was low, I met PM Modi and he gave me motivation: CWG 2022 gold medallist Vinesh
108.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who bagged gold at CWG 2022, said that she almost gave up wrestling as she couldn't win a medal in two successive Olympics. "When I was low, I met Modi ji (PM Narendra Modi) and he gave me motivation. He said 'We trust you and you can do it'. That reignited the spark in me," she stated.

109.title: Ex-Chelsea footballer Willian leaves Corinthians after death threats
109.article_body: Former Arsenal and Chelsea player Willian said he has terminated his contract and left Sao Paulo-based club Corinthians after receiving death threats. "I did not come to Brazil to get threatened...If sometimes I was not doing well...my family received threats and curses," said the Brazilian. On Friday, Willian expressed his wish to return to Europe again.

110.title: Afraid of losing social prestige during ED investigation: Kolkata Mayor
110.article_body: Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) Mayor Firhad Hakim on Saturday said he's not afraid of going to jail, but afraid of losing social prestige during the investigation process of Enforcement Directorate (ED). "Several saints of Bengal have been to jail. But, everyone is scared of loss of...social prestige and while ED starts their investigation, media starts their own trial," Hakim said.

111.title: Firefighters halt spread of "monster" wildfire in France's Gironde
111.article_body: Firefighters have managed to halt the spread of a "monster" blaze that has ravaged forests in France's Gironde region since Tuesday, according to French authorities. Notably, storms are expected to sweep through France on Saturday night, bringing down temperatures and prompting severe weather warnings. Successive heatwaves have sparked wildfires across Europe this summer.

112.title: Carlo Ancelotti to retire after current Real Madrid stint
112.article_body: Record four-time UEFA Champions League-winning head coach Carlo Ancelotti has said that he will retire after his current stint with Real Madrid. "Real Madrid means top level, so it makes sense to consider this club as the end of my career," said the 63-year-old. Ancelotti's current contract with the club runs until June 2024.

113.title: Will hold classes for those doubting RSS' contribution in independence: Surya
113.article_body: BJYM President Tejasvi Surya said that the BJP's youth wing will hold history classes for those who are questioning RSS' contribution to India's freedom struggle. "It is unfortunate that...a typical history was taught which is only about appreciating a single-family. Whereas the contribution of freedom fighters including...Veer Savarkar...and others is purposely neglected," Surya said.

114.title: Pakistan set to attend counter-terror exercises in India: Report
114.article_body: Pakistan will attend counter-terrorism drills which will be hosted by India in October this year, Press Trust of India reported on Saturday quoting Pakistani media. The drills will be held under the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation. The exercise will see participation from China, Russia, Iran, Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan besides India.

115.title: 'Wedding kits' with condoms, contraceptive pills to be given to newly married couples in Odisha
115.article_body: Odisha government has decided to provide 'wedding kits' to newly married couples from September to raise awareness about family planning. The kits will contain contraceptive pills, condoms and a booklet on methods and benefits of family planning among other items. "This is...part of the National Health Mission's 'Nai Pahal Scheme'," Director of Family Planning Bijay Panigrahy said.

116.title: A lot of older players will get offers from various T20 leagues: Chappell
116.article_body: Former cricketer Ian Chappell said that many "older players will get offers" from various T20 leagues and it will pose a challenge to several cricket boards. "If you've got a decent IPL contract and the choice is between Australia and your IPL franchise's UAE team, well are you going to put your IPL contract at risk?" Chappell asked.

117.title: WHO gives new names to monkeypox variants 'to avoid causing offence'
117.article_body: WHO has announced new names for variants of the monkeypox virus, in order to "avoid causing offence to any cultural, social, national, regional, professional or ethnic groups". The former Congo Basin (Central African) clade has been renamed Clade one (I). The former West African clade will be Clade two (II) and its subclades will be Clade IIa and Clade IIb.

118.title: JK Rowling receives death threat after tweet on Salman Rushdie, shares screenshot
118.article_body: Author JK Rowling received a potential death threat following her reaction tweet to attack on Salman Rushdie in New York. "Feeling very sick right now...Let him be ok," Rowling had written after attack on Rushdie. She shared a screenshot of a user saying, "Don't worry you're next," in response to her tweet. She also shared a picture of the user.

119.title: Test cricket won't die in my lifetime but who'll be playing it: Ian Chappell
119.article_body: Former Australian skipper Ian Chappell has commented on the future of five-day cricket. "Test cricket won't die in my lifetime. But who'll be playing it?" Chappell asked. The 78-year-old added, "If you haven't got your best players, is Test cricket worth watching? The answer is probably no. Test cricket is a good game, but it's got to be well played."

120.title: High salinity found in German-Polish river after mass fish die-off
120.article_body: High levels of salinity were detected in Oder River, which runs through Germany and Poland, after a mass dying off of fish, Poland's Environment Minister Anna Moskwa said on Saturday.  Comprehensive toxicology studies are still underway in Poland, she added. Earlier, Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said that huge amounts of chemical waste were probably dumped in the river.

121.title: 5 BJP workers arrested for throwing slippers at TN Minister's car
121.article_body: Five BJP workers have been arrested for allegedly throwing slippers at Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan's car when he was returning from Madurai Airport. The accused have been arrested under Sections 506, 341 and 34 of the IPC. The minister was returning after paying his respects to one of the soldiers killed in the J&K Rajouri district attack.

122.title: I was once dragged into a jungle by a man in Delhi: Ratan Raajputh
122.article_body: TV actress Ratan Raajputh recalled an incident from her early days in Delhi and revealed that her phone was snatched while she was returning home from Mandi House. She added she chased the person and he brought her far away into a dense forest. "Suddenly a boy appeared...[and] he...dragged me into...forest," Ratan said, adding she got help from a student.

123.title: 4 minors accused of raping married woman in Assam's Morigaon, 1 held
123.article_body: Police on Saturday said that a 16-year-old boy was arrested in Assam's Morigaon district for allegedly raping a married woman. Three other minor boys were also allegedly involved in the crime and are currently absconding, a police official said. The victim approached the police and filed a complaint when her husband refused to "accept her", the official added.

124.title: 4 dead, 9 injured in flash flood in southwest China
124.article_body: A flash flood in southwest China left four people dead and nine others injured on Saturday, local authorities informed. In a video published by Chinese media, tourists playing in a river could be seen running for safety following a rapid rise in the river's water level. The video also showed a woman being swept away by the current.

125.title: Ayodhya Ram Temple construction to be over by December 2023: Trust
125.article_body: The Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra has said the construction of the Ayodhya Ram Temple would be completed by December 2023. "The temple will be ready for 'darshan' by devotees in December 2023," said the Trust's General Secretary Champat Rai. He also claimed that iron was not being used in the construction and the design would amaze people.

126.title: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari rewards CWG medallist Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh
126.article_body: Northeast Delhi BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Friday rewarded CWG 2022 medallist wrestler Divya Kakran with ₹5 lakh. This comes after Divya claimed she had not received help from the Delhi government despite living in the city for 20 years. Divya had requested the AAP government to honour her the way they honour players from Delhi who represent other states.

127.title: Shakib Al Hasan named Bangladesh captain for Asia Cup, T20 World Cup
127.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has appointed Shakib Al Hasan as the captain for the upcoming Asia Cup and T20 World Cup. Before being named captain, Shakib was reportedly told by the cricket board to choose between playing for Bangladesh or keep endorsing "betting company" Betwinner News. The Bangladesh Test captain then ended his contract with the company.

128.title: Gippy praises Aamir's 'Laal...' look, says 'Punjabis don't like fake beards'
128.article_body: Actor-singer Gippy Grewal in an interview praised Aamir Khan's look in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', saying that the actor looks "totally like a Sardaar" in the film. Aamir grew a beard and gained weight for his role in the Advait Chandan directorial. Gippy further said, "As a Punjabi, when we see a 'Punjabi' person with fake beard, we don't like it."

129.title: Used inverted commas: Kerala MLA Jaleel on ‘Azad Kashmir’ remark
129.article_body: CPI(M)-backed Kerala MLA KT Jaleel said he only had "sympathy" for those who didn't understand his use of the double inverted commas in calling Pakistan-occupied Kashmir 'Azad Kashmir'. In his response, however, the legislator did not talk about his use of the words "India-Occupied Jammu and Kashmir". The BJP had called for the MLA to be booked for sedition.

130.title: Woman saves son from cobra in K'taka seconds before it was about to bite him, video viral
130.article_body: A video of a Karnataka woman rescuing her child from a cobra seconds before it was about to bite him has gone viral. The video is from Mandya district, and shows the child unknowingly stepping very close to the cobra. The mother acts immediately, grabs the child, holds him up on her shoulder and runs to safety.

131.title: Why is NASA preparing to crash a spacecraft into an asteroid next month?
131.article_body: NASA has said that it will intentionally crash its Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) spacecraft into an asteroid on September 26, 2022. This will be done to "demonstrate and test" DART's capability to deflect asteroids, NASA said. It could be used if, in the future, a hazardous asteroid on a collision course with Earth was ever found, it added.

132.title: PM's mother distributes national flags to kids in Guj ahead of I-Day
132.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben Modi distributed national flags to children in Gujarat as the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign began on Saturday. A video showed the PM's mother and some children waving the Tricolour at a residence. Heeraben Modi, aged 100, also hoisted the Tricolour ahead of Independence Day. India will celebrate 75 years of independence on August 15.

133.title: Over 2,100 cattle die in Punjab due to lumpy skin disease
133.article_body: The Punjab Animal Husbandry Department has said that more than 2,100 cattle have died while over 60,000 were affected by lumpy skin disease in the state. The disease infects cows and buffaloes leading to the formation of lumps on the animal's skin. Other than Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Gujarat and Andaman and Nicobar Islands have been affected by the disease.

134.title: Patiala Central Jail inmate escapes after finding security lapse
134.article_body: A Patiala Central Jail inmate escaped from the prison by scaling a wall after finding no security there at 7:15 am. The costly live electricity wire fencing the jail had installed was not working at the time. Officials came to know of the escape five hours later when they tried to locate him for his court appearance.

135.title: 15 migrants found dead in desert on border with Sudan: Libya
135.article_body: At least 15 migrants were found dead in the desert on the borders with Sudan, Libyan authorities said on Saturday. The migrants were on their way from Sudan to Libya when their vehicle broke down due to lack of fuel, they added. The migrants likely attempted to reach Libya in an effort to board trafficking boats to Europe.

136.title: The Academy calls 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful Indian adaptation'
136.article_body: The Academy on Saturday called Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' a 'faithful' adaptation of Tom Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "Robert Zemeckis and Eric Roth's sweeping story of a man who changes the world with kindness receives a faithful Indian adaptation," read The Academy's tweet. It further added that 'Forrest Gump' was nominated for 13 Oscars including six wins.

137.title: Time to strike last nail in terrorism's coffin has come: J&K LG
137.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said that "the right time" to "strike the last nail in the coffin of terrorism" in the Union Territory has come. He also said some people were trying to create disturbances at the "behest of the neighbouring country". Sinha added that the younger generations should not face the same hardships as their forefathers.

138.title: Bihar Congress to meet Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday
138.article_body: Bihar Congress in-charge Bhakta Charan Das said the party will hold a meeting with state CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Sunday. The leader said he has already spoken to party chief Sonia Gandhi and leader Rahul Gandhi about the political developments in the state. The new Bihar alliance will undergo a floor test on August 24.

139.title: Punjab Guv clears 'One MLA-One Pension' bill; CM says 'will save tax'
139.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Saturday said that the 'One MLA-One Pension' bill has been cleared by Governor Banwarilal Purohit. "This will save a lot of tax for the public," Mann tweeted. Till now, MLAs received separate payouts for each term they had served. The Governor's assent comes about three months after the state Cabinet cleared the bill.

140.title: Juvenile rape, murder convict released by SC after 19-year term
140.article_body: The Supreme Court released a man who had served a 19-year term for the rape and murder of a minor girl. The court said it was found that the man was a minor while committing the crime and a juvenile cannot be put behind bars for more than three years. He was originally awarded a death sentence in the case.

141.title: 24-yr-old man who stabbed Salman Rushdie charged with attempted murder & assault
141.article_body: Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old New Jersey man who stabbed author Salman Rushdie in New York on Friday, has been charged with attempted murder in the second degree, the Chautauqua County district attorney's office said on Saturday. He has also been charged with assault in the second degree. "He was arraigned on these charges...and remanded without bail," the statement added.

142.title: Russian forces carry out strikes on residential areas across Ukraine
142.article_body: Russia's military carried out strikes on residential areas across Ukraine overnight. A Russian spokesman claimed that a US-supplied multiple rocket launcher was destroyed in strikes near Kramatorsk city. The Ukrainian Governor of Luhansk province, which is part of the fight over Donbas region and was overrun by Russian forces in July, claimed that Ukraine's forces still held a small area.

143.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 found in majority of samples from Delhi
143.article_body: Omicron sub-variant BA.2.75 has been detected in more than half of the samples, analysed as part of a study, from COVID-19 patients in Delhi, LNJP Hospital's MD Dr Suresh Kumar said on Saturday. BA.2.75 is spreading faster than other variants and "escaping immunity", Dr Kumar said. The Omicron sub-variant was first detected in India in June.

144.title: Army chief General Manoj Pande visits Chennai Military Station
144.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande on Saturday visited the Chennai Military Station, a defence release said. General Pande "highlighted the transformative and forward-looking Agnipath scheme", as per the PIB release. According to the release, the Indian Army chief also outlined the changing dynamics of modern warfare. He also highlighted the need for enhancing defence production capabilities.

145.title: Air India flight seats changed despite check-in, says Jet Airways CEO; airline responds
145.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said that recently while boarding an Air India flight with his son, his seats were changed at the gate despite a web check-in. He said the staff couldn't give him a reason for moving him, adding that another family with kids faced the same issue. Air India said it's looking into the issue's "root cause".

146.title: What PM Modi is going to promise in 15th Aug speech this year: Swamy
146.article_body: BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has asked that "what PM Narendra Modi is going to promise" in his Independence Day speech this year. "In his Independence Day speech in 2017, PM Modi made the following promises to be achieved by 15th August of 2022...Two crore new jobs every year...housing for all...doubling farmers' income...bullet train...Has it happened?" Swamy asked.

147.title: 9 killed, 18 injured in road accident in Egypt's Minya province
147.article_body: A road accident involving an overturned microbus in Egypt's Minya province on Friday claimed the lives of at least nine people and left 18 others injured, authorities informed. The passenger vehicle crashed when it overturned on a highway following a tire blowout, a statement by authorities said. The microbus was ferrying people from Sohag province to Cairo, the statement added.

148.title: CRPF personnel injured in grenade attack in Srinagar: Police
148.article_body: Police said that a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel was injured when terrorists hurled a grenade at security forces in Srinagar's Eidgah locality on Saturday. The police said the explosion caused minor splinter injuries to one CRPF personnel. A cordon and search operation has been launched to arrest the culprits, they added.

149.title: CRPF holds 'Har Ghar Tiranga' walkathon rally in J&K's Budgam
149.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) on Friday organised a walkathon rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam area, officials said. The rally was conducted as a part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "We've gathered...to remember and salute the brave hearts who laid down their lives for the nation," 181 Battalion Commandant Om Hari said.

150.title: Land worth ₹6 cr seized in case against Ex-MLA Mukhtar Ansari in UP
150.article_body: Police said that Ghazipur district administration in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday seized two plots of land valued at ₹6.30 crore that were purchased using illegal earnings of jailed former MLA and gangster Mukhtar Ansari. Two plots in Rajdepur and Fatehullahpur were registered in the name of Ansari's wife, police said. The properties were seized under Section 14(1) of Gangsters Act.

151.title: 100 Sikhs & Hindus in Afghanistan waiting to come to India: Sikh leader
151.article_body: Around 100 Afghan Sikhs and Hindus in Afghanistan want to come to India but are unable to as some of their family members are yet to receive their e-visas, an Afghan Sikh leader said. About 28 members of the group are yet to receive their visas. The situation is volatile in Afghanistan, according to the leader.

152.title: PV Sindhu ruled out of Badminton World Championships
152.article_body: PV Sindhu, who bagged a gold medal at CWG 2022, has been ruled out of the upcoming Badminton World Championships due to an ankle injury. As per reports, Sindhu sustained the injury during the quarterfinals of the CWG 2022. Sindhu has won a gold medal, two silver medals and two bronze medals in the history of World Championships.

153.title: Ex-Pak captain Sarfaraz Ahmed's bio added to Class 4 syllabus in Sindh, he shares pics
153.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed's biography has been added to Class 4 syllabus in Pakistan's Sindh. The cricketer took to Twitter to share pictures and wrote, "Thank you! This is a big honour for me. As role models we endeavour to inspire children. I would always be there to play my part in these efforts."

154.title: Would love to see Karthik bat for more overs: Maninder Singh
154.article_body: Former India spinner Maninder Singh has said that he would "love" to see Dinesh Karthik bat for "more" overs for the Indian team. "I would love...but if this is what Rahul Dravid, his captain and the selectors have decided, I think let's back them," Maninder said. He added, "Every coach...[and] every captain comes with a different plan."

155.title: US says India shipped fuel made from Russian crude to America: RBI Deputy Governor
155.article_body: RBI Deputy Governor Michael Patra said India was informed by the US Treasury Department about fuel made from Russian crude being shipped to New York on an Indian ship, in violation of US sanctions on Russia. The ship allegedly picked crude from a Russian tanker mid-sea, brought it to Gujarat for refining and took it to the US, Patra revealed.

156.title: He showed KRK his place: Vindu recalls Raju Srivastava's Bigg Boss journey
156.article_body: Actor Vindu Dara Singh, recalling his 'Bigg Boss 3' days, said that his journey became "much easier" because of co-contestant and comedian Raju Srivastava. He revealed that Raju had a huge fight with Kamaal R Khan (KRK) on the show. "He got angry and really showed KRK his place...he really gave KRK a piece of his mind," said Vindu.

157.title: Akshay Kumar to return as Jagdish Mishra in 'Jolly LLB 3': Report
157.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar will reportedly reprise his role as Jagdish Mishra in 'Jolly LLB 3'. According to a report, the upcoming project will be directed by Subhash Kapoor, who also helmed the first two parts of the franchise. "The third part will be bigger and better than the earlier two," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

158.title: Assam man's corpse buried as locals refuse cremation over inter-caste marriage
158.article_body: A man's body was recently buried by his family in Assam's Darrang after fellow villagers refused to touch his body and help with the cremation as he had married outside his caste, district administration officials said. The officials exhumed the body on Friday. They said Atul Sarma, a Brahmin, had married a woman from Koch community around 27 years ago.

159.title: Live monkey, snakes recovered from passenger at Chennai airport; pics surface
159.article_body: A passenger illegally carrying live animals from Bangkok was intercepted at Chennai airport by Customs officers on Thursday. On examination of checked-in baggage, 1 De Brazza's monkey, 15 kingsnakes, 5 ball pythons and 2 aldabra tortoises were recovered. Since the live animals were imported illegally, they were deported back to the country of origin.

160.title: Punjab govt issues COVID-19 advisory, says 'wear appropriate masks'
160.article_body: Punjab government's Department of Home Affairs issued a COVID-19 advisory on Saturday and said that COVID-19 positive cases and hospitalisation are showing an upward trend. It instructed people to wear appropriate masks in all educational institutions, government and private offices, malls, public places and the like. It also asked people to follow social distancing and respiratory etiquettes.

161.title: Anshu Jain, former co-CEO of Deutsche Bank, passes away at 59 due to duodenal cancer
161.article_body: Former co-CEO of Deutsche Bank Anshu Jain passed away aged 59 after battling duodenal cancer for five years. He was serving as the president of Cantor Fitzgerald. He had served as co-CEO of Deutsche Bank between 2012 and 2015. Before joining Deutsche Bank in 1995, Jain worked at Merrill Lynch. Jain was born in Jaipur.

162.title: CM Bommai is here to stay: BJP on rumours about replacing him
162.article_body: Amid speculations about the replacement of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, BJP National General Secretary in charge of Karnataka Arun Singh on Saturday said Bommai "is here to stay". "Our leadership has placed complete confidence in him," Singh said. "I can say with 100% confidence that the next assembly election will be fought under Basavaraj Bommai," Singh added.

163.title: 2 teenage boys, aged 14 & 15, drown in Swan river in Himachal's Una
163.article_body: Two teenagers drowned in Swan river in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Saturday, the State Disaster Management Authority said. The incident took place when the victims, 14-year-old Sahil and 15-year-old Jatin, from Lower Bhadsali village accidentally drowned while taking bath in Swan river near Lower Batheda of Haroli sub-division, they added.

164.title: HP Assembly passes bill banning forced conversions, extends jail term to 10 yrs
164.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Assembly passed a bill on Saturday forbidding forced mass conversions. The bill also extends the maximum punishment to 10 years imprisonment in its 2019 law against any change of religion through force or allurement. The Himachal Pradesh Freedom of Religion (Amendment) Bill, 2022, was passed unanimously with a voice vote. The state government introduced the bill on Friday.

165.title: World record for largest human image of a waving national flag created in India
165.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, the Guinness World Record for 'Largest Human Image of a Waving National Flag' was created by Chandigarh University and the NID Foundation, a non-governmental organisation, on Saturday. The record was accomplished with the participation of 5,885 people. "One such record was set in the UAE, years ago. Today, that record has been broken," an official stated.

166.title: K'taka policeman suspended for assaulting villager, inquiry ordered
166.article_body: A police sub-inspector (PSI), Manikanta, was suspended from duty and a departmental inquiry was ordered after a video surfaced of him assaulting a villager in Karnataka's Ballari district, the police said. According to the police, the victim has been identified as Gangadhar, a villager in the same district. According to villagers, the policeman and Gangadhar had an old personal rivalry.

167.title: 27% of Ukraine will need to be cleared of mines & explosives: Govt
167.article_body: Ukraine's Ecology Ministry estimates that about 27% of the country's territory will need to be cleared of mines and explosives. Making that area safe could take a decade, the government said. Notably, the US has approved $89 million worth of assistance to help Ukraine equip and train 100 teams to clear landmines and unexploded ordnance for a year.

168.title: Minor girl kills herself at lover's residence in UP
168.article_body: A minor girl allegedly died by suicide at the residence of her lover in Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, her lover, who lived in the neighbourhood, also allegedly tried to kill himself by consuming poison and is admitted to a local hospital, police said. The girl was found hanging at the boy's residence on Saturday morning, police added.

169.title: 38-yr-old farmer killed by unidentified miscreants in UP's Sambhal
169.article_body: A 38-year-old farmer, Vijay Kumar, was killed by unidentified miscreants while he was working in his farm in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal, police said on Saturday. The farmer was killed using a sharp-edged weapon, Additional Superintendent of Police Aalok Jaiswal said. Prima facie, the incident appears to be a result of personal enmity, Jaiswal added.

170.title: BJP does what it says; we get this inspiration from sons of soil: Rajnath
170.article_body: Union Minister Rajnath Singh has said that "the BJP does what it says". "We get this inspiration from sons of the soil like [Rajput general] Veer Durgadas Rathore," Rajnath said at an event in Jodhpur. He added, "We need to learn from Rathore at a time when some powers are conspiring to widen the rift between Hindus and Muslims."

171.title: Delhi HC criticises DDA for woman's 30-year-long wait to get Rohini plot
171.article_body: The Delhi High Court has criticised Delhi Development Authority (DDA) for failing to give a plot in Rohini to an octogenarian woman, who had an allotment letter since 1991. The court upheld a single-bench decision directing the DDA to give a 60 sq metre plot to the woman within four weeks. The court called the DDA "lackadaisical and abhorrently unprofessional".

172.title: 24 cadaver donations made in Pune this year
172.article_body: As many as 24 cadaver donations have been done in Pune city this year. "So far this year, Pune has seen the maximum organ donations across Maharashtra," said Arti Gokhale, Central Coordinator of the Zonal Transplant Coordination Committee. In Maharashtra this year, Mumbai has carried out 22 organ transplants, followed by Nagpur at five and Aurangabad at one.

173.title: Cut-off marks in 2nd merit list drop in FYJC admissions in Pune
173.article_body: The second merit list of first-year junior college (FYJC) admissions in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions has seen a drop in cut-off marks for the top 10 colleges. Of the 59,517 available seats in the second round, 41,115 applications were received and 17,062 students were allotted a college. In this round, 5,586 students got the college of their first choice.

174.title: Class 12 student stabbed to death in a clash between students in Bengaluru
174.article_body: A clash between two college groups led to the death of a class 12 student near a college located in the HBR layout area of Bengaluru.
