The deceased, Arbaaz Mohammad (18), had a verbal spat with one of his seniors during the cultural fest a few days before the latter along with his associates stabbed Arbaaz to death, police said.

175.title: DGCA issues guidelines to prevent bird strikes at airports
175.article_body: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Saturday issued guidelines to check incidents of collision of planes with birds and other animals at airports across India. It stated that all airport operators must review their wildlife hazard management programme and ensure its strict implementation. Airports must have a procedure to monitor and record wildlife movement data, the regulator added.

176.title: Sri Lanka allows entry to Chinese 'spy' ship despite India's concerns: Report
176.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday granted docking permission to a Chinese surveillance ship despite India's concerns over it being used to 'spy' on its military installations, a report said, quoting officials. Sri Lanka's harbour master said he has received diplomatic clearance to allow Yuan Wang 5 to dock at Hambantota port from August 16 to 22, the report added.

177.title: 2 more ships leave Ukraine under grain export deal: Turkey
177.article_body: Two more ships carrying agricultural products departed from Ukraine's Black Sea ports on Saturday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. This takes the number of cargo ships to leave Ukraine through the Black Sea under the grain export deal signed in July to 16. Turkey's Defence Ministry also said that another ship would leave Turkey for Ukraine on Saturday to buy grains.

178.title: Shanghai extends weekly COVID-19 testing requirement till Sept end
178.article_body: Authorities in China's Shanghai on Saturday announced that the measure under which residents need to undergo weekly COVID-19 testing has been extended till the end of September. Individuals without a record of a nucleic acid test in the past seven days would be assigned a yellow code on Shanghai's health code system. A yellow code limits access to public places.

179.title: Golden joint of world's highest railway bridge in J&K completed, govt shares pics
179.article_body: Work on the golden joint of the world's highest railway bridge on the Chenab river has been completed, Railways said on Saturday. It shared pictures and videos from the ceremony to mark golden joint completion (which indicates bridge is around 98% complete) in J&K. Workers were seen hosting the national flag, burning firecrackers and chanting 'Vande Mataram' at the ceremony.

180.title: Canadian city declares state of emergency over water scarcity
180.article_body: Iqaluit, a Canadian city in the Arctic region, on Friday declared a state of emergency after the local Apex River's water levels hit a four-decade low due to scarce rainfall this year. The city has warned that the water in its reservoir could prove to be inadequate to sustain its population of about 7,800 during the freeze-up of winter months.

181.title: Vijay Sethupathi to play a negative role in Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan'
181.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming 'Jawan' will feature Vijay Sethupathi in a negative role. The film, being directed by Atlee Kumar, will also feature Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra. 'Jawan' is scheduled to release in theatres on June 2, 2023. Vijay is also working on 'Merry Christmas', a Sriram Raghavan directorial also starring Katrina Kaif and Sanjay Kapoor.

182.title: Man arrested for hoisting Pakistan's national flag in UP
182.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly hoisting the national flag of Pakistan at his residence in Vedupar Mustaquil village in Kushinagar, Uttar Pradesh. According to the police, the flag was removed as soon as the officials were informed. Notably, the arrested accused is identified as Salman (21) while two others, including a woman, have been booked, police said.

183.title: Rajasthan Royals owner slapped me 3-4 times in a bar after I got out for a duck: Taylor
183.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor, in his autobiography, revealed one of the Rajasthan Royals' owners slapped him three-four times in a bar after he got out for a duck against Punjab Kings in 2011. "[The owner] said, 'Ross...we didn't pay you a million dollars to get a duck'...I couldn't imagine it happening in many professional sporting environments," Taylor wrote.

184.title: Guj ex-Dy CM suffers leg fracture as cow hits him at Tiranga Yatra, video surfaces
184.article_body: Former Gujarat Deputy Chief Minister Nitin Patel suffered a minor fracture in his leg after being attacked by a stray cow in Kadi during a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Saturday. Patel said the cow "suddenly came running" and attacked him near a vegetable market. A video showed Patel and other people falling to the ground after the cow rushed past them.

185.title: Taliban fighters fire in air to disperse women protesters in Kabul
185.article_body: Taliban fighters in Kabul fired into the air to disperse a group of women protesting in front of the Education Ministry building. Some of the women protesters who took refuge in nearby shops were chased and beaten by Taliban fighters with their rifle butts. Notably, this comes days ahead of the first anniversary of Taliban's return to power in Afghanistan.

186.title: My role was first offered to Govinda: Anil on 23 yrs of 'Taal'
186.article_body: Anil Kapoor took to Instagram to share a post marking 23 years of his film 'Taal'. He recalled how he was "destined" to be a part of 'Taal' as the role that he played in the film was first offered to Govinda. Anil added it was his performance in 'Taal' that got him a role in Danny Boyle's 'Slumdog Millionaire'.

187.title: Nick Kyrgios' 9-match winning streak ends in Canadian Masters QF
187.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios' nine-match winning streak came to an end on Friday after the 27-year-old lost his quarter-final match to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz at the Canadian Masters in Montreal. However, when being asked about the streak getting ended, Kyrgios quipped, "I honestly don't care...Have been away from my mum...[and] dad...They're not very well at the moment."

188.title: Man digs tunnel to rob bank in Italy, rescued as tunnel collapses
188.article_body: A man who allegedly dug a tunnel as part of a planned bank heist in Italy was rescued by police after the tunnel collapsed. The man is suspected to be part of a four-member gang that planned to carry out the robbery in Rome this weekend. The other three suspects reportedly fled the six-metre tunnel before it collapsed.

189.title: Man killed on busy road in Delhi after argument over urinating on wall, says police
189.article_body: A 25-year-old hotel management graduate was stabbed to death by four men in Delhi's Malviya Nagar. He was attacked following an altercation that started over him urinating on a wall, slapping one of the men and abusing his mother who objected to his urination, police said. The men were arrested after they were identified with the help of CCTV footage.

190.title: MS Dhoni changes his Instagram DP to Tricolour with caption in 3 languages
190.article_body: Former India captain MS Dhoni changed his Instagram display picture (DP) to a Tricolour ahead of India's 76th Independence Day. The picture contained a caption in three languages: Sanskrit, Hindi and English. "I am blessed to be a Bharatiya," it read in English. PM Narendra Modi had urged citizens to change their profile pictures on social media to National Flag.

191.title: Police beef up security at Red Fort ahead of PM's I-Day address
191.article_body: Security at Delhi's Red Fort has been beefed up ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's address to the nation on Independence Day from the Mughal-era monument. Apart from the 10,000 police personnel who will be deployed around the monument on Monday, anti-drone systems and facial recognition systems are also being installed. Around 7,000 attendees are expected at the event.

192.title: Portion of Thane residential building collapses, no one hurt
192.article_body: A portion of a five-storey residential building in Thane's Daighar area has collapsed, officials said on Saturday. No one was hurt in the incident which occurred on Friday night. Residents and the shops on the ground floor have been evacuated and the building has been marked for being pulled down, chief of the Regional Disaster Management Cell Avinash Sawant said.

193.title: T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature: Williamson
193.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson has said that "T20 cricket can be very fickle in its nature". "We are just trying to improve and bring guys into the side and give them clear roles...Just trying to keep things nice and simple," Williamson said. New Zealand took an unassailable lead of 2-0 in the series against the West Indies on Friday.

194.title: 6 arrested from Delhi's outer district for fuel theft from tankers
194.article_body: Six men were arrested from Delhi's outer district area on Friday after they were allegedly caught siphoning fuel from tankers. Police said they received information that one Amarjeet would siphon fuel from tankers at Swarn Park and sell the stolen fuel. Owner of one of the tankers from which fuel was allegedly being siphoned gave a complaint to the police.

195.title: Brazil reports record deforestation in Amazon from Jan-July in 2022
195.article_body: Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon rainforest reached a record high for the first seven months of the year, according to preliminary government data. Government satellite data showed 5,474 square kilometres were cleared in the region from January to July, up 7.3% from the same period of last year. Notably, 1,487 square kilometres were cleared in July alone.

196.title: 21,000 fish killed due to ‘catastrophic failure’ at California university
196.article_body: A "catastrophic failure" has resulted in the loss of about 21,000 fish at a university research facility in California. "The loss appears to be due to chlorine exposure, to which fish are...sensitive," a statement read. The University of California, Davis, said it has initiated an independent external review to determine where its systems failed and potential risks at similar facilities.

197.title: Women need to sleep with someone for K'taka govt job, says Cong MLA; BJP responds
197.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge on Friday stated that "men have to bribe while young women have to sleep with someone to get a government job" in BJP-ruled Karnataka. He demanded an investigation into recruitment scams. BJP leader and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Whatever he said was happening during Congress rule- at the Centre and in state."

198.title: 3 men pose as policemen to rob gold worth ₹22 lakh in Mumbai, arrested
198.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing gold worth ₹22 lakh from a man who had recently returned from Dubai. According to the police, the men posed as police officials and stopped the victim's auto-rickshaw. On the pretext of checking the vehicle, they robbed the gold and escaped on a bike. Another accused is currently absconding, police added.

199.title: Protests were aimed at overthrowing govt: Sierra Leone's Prez
199.article_body: Sierra Leone's President Julius Maada Bio on Friday said that this week's anti-government protests were an attempt to overthrow the government. The protests led to the deaths of six police officers and at least 21 civilians. However, several residents have said that the protests were driven by frustration with the worsening economic situation, according to Reuters.

200.title: I feel those are shortcuts: 'Taare...' actor Darsheel on asking Aamir for work
200.article_body: Darsheel Safary, who started his acting career with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Taare Zameen Par', has said he could've approached Aamir for another film, but didn't feel like taking the "shortcut". "I feel those are like shortcuts," Darsheel said, adding, "Not that I want to take a long cut but a learning cut. I think I don't need to force."

201.title: US man builds own broadband to avoid high net access fee, gets ₹20 cr from govt
201.article_body: A man in US' Michigan who built his own broadband to avoid a $50,000 (around ₹40 lakh) fee to extend web access to his home, has now won a $2.6 million (₹20 crore) government bid. Network engineer Jared Mauch set up his own Internet Service Provider and got 70 customers. He's now been funded to expand to 600 additional homes.

202.title: Aamir joins Har Ghar Tiranga campaign, displays Tricolour at his house
202.article_body: Aamir Khan displayed the Tricolour at his Mumbai residence on Friday as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign was introduced by PM Narendra Modi to mark 75 years of India's independence. Aamir, while reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, had said, "I feel sad some...people who're saying this...believe...I'm someone who doesn't like India...but it's untrue."

203.title: Coffee Day Enterprises narrows net loss to ₹18 crore in Q1
203.article_body: Coffee Day Enterprises reported a narrowing of its consolidated net loss to ₹18 crore for the quarter ended June 30 as against a net loss of ₹117.28 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. Its revenue from operations jumped to ₹210.49 crore as against ₹81.52 crore in the year-ago period. Its expenses also saw a 17.96% rise to ₹237.75 crore.

204.title: Direct your complaints to Kremlin: Ukraine to Russians against travel ban
204.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians who're upset with the prospect of being banned from tourist travel to Europe can direct their complaints to the Kremlin and over 70% of their compatriots who support the war." Kuleba's comments came after Ukrainian President Zelenskyy called on European Union states to ban visas for rich Russian nationals.

205.title: NMDC sets target to produce 46 million tonnes of iron ore in FY23
205.article_body: Government-owned miner NMDC Limited has set a goal to achieve 46 million tonnes of iron ore production in the current financial year, Chairman and Managing Director Sumit Deb said. This would be 10% higher than that of last year, he added. NMDC achieved the production of 42.19 MT and sales of 40.56 MT in FY22 with a ₹25,882 crore turnover.

206.title: RSS changes social media profile pics to Tricolour ahead of Independence Day
206.article_body: Ahead of Independence Day, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) changed the display pictures of its social media accounts to the Tricolour from its traditional saffron flag. RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat also changed his social media profile pictures to the national flag. This comes after several political leaders criticised RSS for not changing its profile pictures amid the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign.

207.title: 200 children take part in NDRF-led National Flag rally in Hyderabad
207.article_body: Around 200 children participated in the National Flag rally led by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) in Hyderabad's Hamidullah Nagar. "As a part of the Har Ghar Tiranga programme...we gave...National Flags to the kids and also made them aware of its significance," Shaikpet Assistant Commandant Damodhar Singh said. The event was conducted as part of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav'.

208.title: Labourer electrocuted to death while setting up Tricolour in Chhattisgarh
208.article_body: A 36-year-old contract labourer working with the local civic body was electrocuted to death in Chhattisgarh's Korea district on Saturday. The incident took place when the deceased, identified as Suman Tigga, was erecting the national flag on a mast along with another labourer, a police official said. "His colleague Ramkripal Singh suffered injuries and is hospitalised," the official added.

209.title: BMC to spend ₹7 cr to fix pothole-ridden roads in Mumbai
209.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to spend ₹7 crore to fix pothole-ridden roads in the city. The BMC will issue the work order before Ganesh Utsav and the work will begin soon after, Additional Municipal Commissioner P Velrasu said. "We have floated tender for three new techniques for filling the potholes in Mumbai," Velrasu added.

210.title: Meghalaya CM Sangma a puppet appointed by Delhi: TMC leader
210.article_body: TMC leader Mukul Sangma on Friday said the NPP-led Meghalaya Democratic Alliance (MDA) government has been formed by PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. "CM Conrad Sangma is merely a puppet appointed by Delhi," Mukul further said. His reaction came a day after NPP announced that it will contest the Meghalaya Assembly elections alone next year.

211.title: Centre misusing central probe agencies: Tejashwi Yadav
211.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav alleged that the Centre is misusing the central probe agencies for its political gains. He also added that Mahagathbandhan will not be "scared" by such tactics. "CBI, ED, IT Department are being ruined one by one. Their condition is worse than a police station...[Bihar has] a pro-people government [and]...will work with strength," said Yadav.

212.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Asaram’s bail plea
212.article_body: The Supreme Court has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by self-styled godman Asaram Bapu. Asaram filed an appeal in the apex court against Gujarat High Court's December 10, 2021 order rejecting his bail plea in the rape case. A bench posted the case for hearing on September 7.

213.title: India resumes mango exports to US after 2 years due to pandemic
213.article_body: India resumed mango exports to the US, with over 1,000 tonne of Alphonso, Kesar and other varieties having been shipped recently. The exports were halted for two years because inspectors from the US Department of Agriculture couldn't visit India to inspect the irradiation facilities due to the travel restrictions induced by the COVID-19 pandemic.

214.title: Nothing unconventional: Roshan on relationship with Shefali in Darlings
214.article_body: Discussing his relationship with actress Shefali Shah in 'Darlings', where she's seen portraying Alia Bhatt's mother, actor Roshan Mathew said, "There is nothing unconventional...about this." "(His initial hesitation) is because of society," added Roshan. Discussing her onscreen kiss with Roshan, Shefali had said it took her by "surprise". "She does it [as] she wants to shut him up," she added.

215.title: Russia blocking access to medicines: Ukraine Health Minister
215.article_body: Ukraine's Health Minister Viktor Liashko said Russian authorities have repeatedly blocked efforts to provide state-subsidised drugs to people in areas that its forces have occupied, since invading the country in February. "We consider these actions 'to be crimes against humanity' and war crimes that will be documented and will be recognised," Liashko added, while talking to The Associated Press.

216.title: KKR franchise keen to acquire a team in women's IPL: Report
216.article_body: The Knight Riders Group, the owner of the IPL franchise KKR, is reportedly keen to own a team in the upcoming women's IPL tournament. According to a Sportskeeda report, the franchise is likely to be Kolkata-based. A source told Sportskeeda that the Knight Riders Group is keen on working with the Cricket Association of Bengal to "groom and pick players".

217.title: Top Cong leaders to meet on Aug 16 ahead of 'mega' protest on price rise
217.article_body: Ahead of "mega" protest rally against price rise and unemployment, Congress has called a meeting of all its general secretaries and state incharges on August 16 to finalise the strategy for 'Mehngai Chaupals'. The party has planned to stage a series of protests in retail markets and other locations in all Assembly constituencies from August 17 to August 23.

218.title: China's actions fundamentally at odds with goal of peace: US
218.article_body: The White House on Friday said that China's actions are fundamentally at odds with the goal of peace and stability. The comment was made in response to recent Chinese actions due to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "They are part of an intensified pressure campaign against Taiwan, which has not ended," it added.

219.title: RBI directs loan recovery agents to not harass borrowers over dues
219.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday directed banks and regulated entities to ensure that their recovery agents do not resort to harassment or intimidation of borrowers over dues. The RBI observed that the recovery agents are not following the extant instructions. It also set the timing for the call for recovery between 8 am and 7 pm.

220.title: Rosneft-backed Nayara Energy reports ₹3,564 crore profit in Q1
220.article_body: Nayara Energy, backed by Russian oil company Rosneft, reported a net profit of ₹3,563.7 crore in the April-June quarter as against a loss of ₹139.1 crore in the corresponding period last year. Its profit in the January-March quarter was ₹409.5 crore. Nayara Energy operates over 6,500 petrol pumps in the country and a refinery at Vadinar in Gujarat.

221.title: J&K govt sacks Hizbul chief's son, JKLF chief Bitta Karate's wife over terror links
221.article_body: J&K administration on Saturday sacked four government employees for alleged links with terror groups. Jammu Kashmir Liberation Front's (JKLF) terror-accused chief Bitta Karate's wife Assabha Arzoomand Khan and Hizbul Mujahideen chief Syed Salahuddin's son Syed Abdul Mueed are reportedly among them. Khan was a Jammu and Kashmir Administrative Service officer. Mueed worked as an IT manager.

222.title: Government cannot deny benefits to non-religious people: Kerala HC
222.article_body: Kerala High Court said that citizens from economically weaker sections cannot be denied benefits because they do not identify with a religion. "The government has to formulate a policy for issuing certificates to persons like petitioners who've declared themselves to be non-religious," it added. "A government that claims to be progressive cannot deny benefits to such citizens," HC stated.

223.title: SUV hits parked truck as driver tries to save cow in Maha; 4 dead
223.article_body: Four people were killed and one other person was injured after an SUV rammed into a parked truck in Maharashtra's Chandrapur, police said on Saturday. The accident occurred after the SUV's driver lost control over the vehicle while trying to save a cow sitting on the road, an assistant inspector said. The injured person was taken to a hospital.

224.title: China to send fighter jets & bombers to Thailand for military drills
224.article_body: China is sending fighter jets and bombers to Thailand for a joint exercise with the Thai military on Sunday. The Chinese Defence Ministry said that the training will include air support, strikes on ground targets and small- and large-scale troop deployment. The training comes as the US holds military drills in Indonesia with Indonesia, Australia, Japan and Singapore.

225.title: Noida woman grabs e-rickshaw driver's collar, slaps him 17 times for hitting her car
225.article_body: A video showing a woman slapping an e-rickshaw driver at least 17 times for allegedly hitting her car in Noida has surfaced online. The woman can be seen grabbing the man by his collar and taking him to the car. The woman can also be seen asking the man for his e-rickshaw's keys and forcefully checking his pockets.

226.title: Earlier Indian flag was burnt, today it can be hoisted across J&K: Thakur
226.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has said that in the past, the Indian flag was burnt in Jammu and Kashmir but now it can be hoisted anywhere. "After the abrogation of Article 370 and Article 35A under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, now one can hoist the national flag in any corner of J&K," Thakur said.

227.title: Revenue department official arrested for taking ₹25,000 bribe in Jammu
227.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested a revenue department official in Jammu for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹25,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a bribe of ₹50,000 from the complainant for issuing documents of land owned by him. CBI then laid a trap and arrested the accused. Cash worth ₹2 lakh was also recovered during searches, CBI said.

228.title: The schedule is broken: Styris on Boult giving up NZ central contract
228.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's Trent Boult, the current world number one ODI bowler, giving up his central contract, ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said, "It's...a bigger message that the schedule is broken." "Cricket can't afford to lose the likes of Ben Stokes and Boult...away from the international game," added Styris. "Nobody...thought...Boult is going to finish up...this soon," he stated.

229.title: PCMC says it's filled 1,800 potholes at the cost of ₹1 crore
229.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has said that it's filled 1,800 potholes or 88% of potholes in its jurisdiction at the cost of ₹1 crore. It'd taken time to fill potholes due to continuous rains, PCMC City Engineer (Civil) Makarand Nikam said. "We need...long dry spell so that pothole filling work can be carried out to last long," Nikam added.

230.title: 14-15 of my films had not worked a few yrs ago, so I thought of moving to Canada: Akshay
230.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about holding a Canadian passport, said he "is an Indian, from India, and will always remain so". "A few years ago, my films weren't working. Almost 14-15 films hadn't worked...I thought I should probably move elsewhere and work there," he added. Akshay further said after he began experiencing professional success again, he decided he should stay back.

231.title: Oppn ready with 'waiting list' of PM candidates without vacancy: Naqvi
231.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said the Opposition has already prepared a "waiting list of two dozen prime ministerial candidates" even when there is no vacancy for the post. He further added that "those suffering from political disease of Modi phobia will vanish soon". The former Union Minister was addressing a programme in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district.

232.title: Sameer Wankhede gets clean chit in certificate case; panel says 'not Muslim by birth'
232.article_body: A Maharashtra caste scrutiny committee gave a clean chit to former NCB Zonal Director Sameer Wankhede in caste certificate case stating he wasn't a Muslim by birth. "It's not proven Wankhede and his father converted to Islam...they belonged to Mahar-37 Scheduled Caste," the order reads. Wankhede used a fake certificate to get government jobs, former minister Nawab Malik had claimed.

233.title: Astronaut sends I-Day greetings to India from Space Station, govt shares video
233.article_body: Ahead of India's Independence Day on August 15, astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti sent greetings from the International Space Station (ISS). In a video shared by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), the astronaut said, "It's a pleasure to congratulate India on 75 years of Independence." She also mentioned international agencies' cooperation with ISRO on the NISAR Earth Science Mission.

234.title: 5 die in Bihar's Saran, suspected to have consumed hooch
234.article_body: At least five people have died in Bihar's Saran district allegedly after consuming spurious liquor. "It is being said that these people died after consuming alcohol, however, it is not yet confirmed if they actually drank it," the Sub-Divisional Magistrate said. Around 10-12 people were arrested on Friday night after police personnel raided the Marhaura area in Saran.

235.title: Bombay HC orders ₹2 lakh as damages for wrongly keeping Nigerian man in jail
235.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the Maharashtra government to pay ₹2 lakh to a Nigerian man jailed since October 2020 on the basis of an erroneous forensic report. The court has ordered to recover the amount from the errant officer of a forensic science laboratory, which has admitted its official's mistake. The judgement was given by Justice Bharati Dangre.

236.title: 1 killed, dozens injured as music festival stage collapses in Spain
236.article_body:
At least one person was killed and dozens others were injured after high winds caused part of a stage to collapse at a music festival in Spain on Saturday, regional emergency services said. Another infrastructure was also reportedly damaged when gusts battered the Medusa Festival. 
Of those wounded, three people have suffered serious trauma injuries, the emergency services added.

237.title: Don't know how he's feeling, I don't sleep with Haaland, jokes Guardiola
237.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola jokingly said he doesn't know how striker Erling Haaland is feeling after playing two games for the club, adding he doesn't "sleep" with him. "I am not at home with Haaland so I don't know how he handles it," added Guardiola. "People said he was a failure and...everyone laughed at him," Guardiola had earlier stated.

238.title: Telegram gets approval for app update after CEO blames Apple for delay
238.article_body: Telegram has released its new iOS update after getting approval from Apple. Earlier this week, Telegram CEO Pavel Durov had complained about the update being "stuck in Apple's review for two weeks". In a new post, Durov said the approval was granted after Telegram accepted Apple's demand to remove "Telemoji", vector-animated versions of the standard emoji, from the update.

239.title: 7 MP BJYM office-bearers removed from posts over ruckus at temple
239.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) has removed seven officer-bearers from their posts for allegedly creating ruckus at the Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain earlier this week. The incident occurred during the organisation's National President and BJP MP Tejasvi Surya's visit. State BJYM President Vaibhav Pawar issued a list of 18 workers and leaders involved in the incident.

240.title: Canara Bank cheated of ₹2.71 cr by fake companies in Hyderabad
240.article_body: Two fake companies allegedly cheated Hyderabad's Balanagar branch of Canara Bank of ₹2.71 crore by taking loans and not repaying them. A company AFS Constructions reportedly took a loan of ₹1.3 crore from the bank and officials later found that this was a fictional company. Similarly, ₹1.41 crore was given to Tirumala Enterprises Civil Engineering company based on fake documents.

241.title: 22-year-old woman in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 5th case in national capital
241.article_body: Delhi has reported its fifth confirmed monkeypox case in a 22-year-old woman. "The patient was admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital (LNJP) and her sample tested positive for monkeypox on Friday," MD LNJP Hospital Dr Suresh Kumar said. "At present, four patients are admitted, one discharged. Total five cases have been so far reported here," Kumar added.

242.title: What has Aamir done to deserve this: Mona on boycott 'Laal Singh...' trend
242.article_body: Actress Mona Singh, reacting to the calls to boycott Aamir Khan-starrer film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "I was very sad." "What has Aamir done to deserve this? He's a guy who has...entertained us for...last 30 years," Mona said, adding, "But I was very confident that...boycotters would come around once they started seeing that the film is resonating with every Indian."

243.title: Authorities take away pit bull that attacked woman in Gurugram
243.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram on Friday took custody of the pet pit bull that attacked and severely injured a woman on Thursday in the Civil Lines area. The dog will remain under a veterinary doctor's observation, an official said. On the basis of the doctor's report, the dog will either be returned to its owner or sent for training.

244.title: 2 B'luru hospitals directed to reserve beds for high-risk COVID patients
244.article_body: Amid a surge in COVID-19 infections, the Karnataka health department has directed two COVID-19 care hospitals in Bengaluru to reserve beds for high-risk patients. The directive has been issued for CV Raman General Hospital and Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College Hospital. Notably, Bengaluru has reported over 1,000 COVID-19 cases on at least five days since July 27.

245.title: 'Pushpa' actor Allu Arjun declines ₹10 crore deal to promote liquor brand: Report
245.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' actor Allu Arjun has reportedly rejected an offer to promote a liquor brand. According to Manobala Vijayabalan, a columnist and film industry tracker, Allu Arjun declined a ₹10 crore deal from a gutkha and liquor brand. Currently, he is charging ₹7.5 crore for brand endorsements, Vijayabalan's tweet further read.

246.title: Mumbai Police bust mobile stealing gang; 12 arrested in last 1 month
246.article_body: The Mumbai Police have busted a mobile stealing gang and have arrested 12 people in connection in the last one month. The police have been able to recover over 700 mobile phones, which were stolen from various parts of Mumbai, police said. The gang allegedly used to send good-quality stolen phones to Bangladesh while older ones were sold in India.

247.title: Portfolios to be allocated soon: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
247.article_body: Talking about the new cabinet, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that portfolios will be allocated to the newly-appointed ministers soon. Eknath Shinde expanded his cabinet 41 days after taking oath as the Chief Minister. He inducted 18 ministers, nine from the BJP and nine from his rebel Shiv Sena group.

248.title: 9-day-old baby gets hit by stone pelted by drunk man in UP, dies
248.article_body: A nine-day-old baby died on Friday after she was hit by one of the stones that a drunk man had hurled at some people in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. The man had climbed the roof of his house and started pelting stones on being confronted by people whom he'd abused, the SP said. The infant died during treatment, the SP added.

249.title: IAS Shah Faesal, who quit civil services to join politics, reinstated in Central govt
249.article_body: IAS officer Shah Faesal has been appointed as Deputy Secretary in the Union Tourism Ministry. Faesal, who became the first Kashmiri to top the civil services exam in 2010, was reinstated in the services earlier this year. He quit civil services in 2019 and later floated his own political party. The 39-year-old quit politics the following year.

250.title: Sunak criticised for building huge swimming pool at his manor as UK faces drought
250.article_body: UK's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak is being criticised for building a huge swimming pool at his luxury mansion after an official drought was declared across large parts of the country. Aerial pictures showing the construction of the 12-metre by 5-metre swimming pool have also surfaced. As per reports, the construction of the pool is estimated to cost about £400,000.

251.title: Govt hasn't given a timeline for selling IDBI stake: LIC Chairman
251.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), which owns a 49.2% stake in IDBI Bank, said that the government hasn't given it any timeline for IDBI stake sale. LIC Chairman MR Kumar said that the divestment department is working on it but so far no expression of interest has been called in. He added there has been no formal proposal from the department.

252.title: We disagree with the order: Vauld as ED freezes assets worth ₹370 cr
252.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) froze assets worth ₹370 crore of the crypto lending platform Vauld's Indian arm, Flipvolt, for allegedly assisting predatory lending apps, the company has come out with a statement saying, "We respectfully disagree with the freezing order." Vauld further said that it strictly adheres to KYC requirements in every country, including India.

253.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie appalling, reprehensible: US
253.article_body: The attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in New York is "appalling" and "reprehensible", US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said. "All of us in the Biden-Harris Administration are praying for his speedy recovery," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was stabbed by a 24-year-old man when he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution.

254.title: Class 11 girl raped by self-proclaimed doctor in UP, probe launched
254.article_body: A self-proclaimed doctor allegedly raped a class 11 girl in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur district, police said on Friday. The incident reportedly occurred a month ago when the girl had visited the doctor for chest pain treatment. "A probe has been ordered into the medical degrees of the so-called doctor and a search is on for him," police said.

255.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda hoist Tricolour as part of 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
255.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, along with his wife, on Saturday, hoisted the Tricolour at his residence in New Delhi as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "Tiranga is our pride. It unites and inspires everyone Indian," he tweeted. BJP national president JP Nadda also hoisted the Tricolour with his family at his residence in New Delhi.

256.title: Sincere Gratitude: Taiwan thanks US for maintaining security in region
256.article_body: Taiwan's Foreign Ministry expressed "sincere gratitude" towards the US for taking "concrete actions" to maintain security and peace in the Taiwan Strait and the region. US Indo-Pacific coordinator Kurt Campbell on Friday had said that China "overreacted" to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. China launched military drills around the self-ruled island in response to the visit.

257.title: Small plane crash lands on busy road, bursts into flames in US; video surfaces
257.article_body: A video of a small plane crash landing on a busy road and bursting into flames in US' California has surfaced online. The video shows the plane sliding to the side of the road amid plumes of smoke after catching fire. "The plane broke apart and ignited. The two occupants were able to safely exit the wreckage," fire department said.

258.title: Unnao rape survivor seeks transfer of case to Delhi
258.article_body: The Unnao rape survivor has filed a petition in the Supreme Court seeking transfer of a criminal case against her to Delhi. She said that the case before the Unnao court is being pursued with the "oblique motive to intimidate, silence and harass" her. She claimed that there is a grave threat to her life in Unnao.

259.title: Sambit Patra criticises Delhi CM over freebies culture
259.article_body: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal over freebies culture. "Kejriwal has just one goal to establish the prominence of AAP in the country...Freebies are baits to lure [people] so that the ambitions of Arvind Kejriwal get fulfilled. He acts as if he is worried for the entire world but he is worried only about himself," said Patra.

260.title: Babar's rough patch won't continue that long: Aaqib Javed on Kohli
260.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Babar Azam is a technically sound player and his rough patch won't continue as long as Virat Kohli. "Kohli gets stuck...with...deliveries outside off-stump. James Anderson has targeted that a million times," added Javed. "Kohli is now...trying not to play those deliveries from a distance. When you change your technique, these problems...surface," he stated.

261.title: Dr Soni recommends Skin Foods Glow Mix over anti-ageing creams: Kapiva
261.article_body: Kapiva revealed its Skin Foods Glow Mix with 10+ Ayurvedic herbs works on inner layers of skin, unlike creams and serums that work on outer layer that gets replaced every 27 days. Research says that skin, the largest organ starts ageing in the 20s, Kapiva stated, adding that Glow Mix aids nutrition, naturally boosts collagen, glutathione and hyaluronic acid synthesis.

262.title: India to miss year-end renewable energy target: Experts
262.article_body: India is going to miss the renewable energy target for the end of the year because of several shortcomings such as taxes on imported components and lack of financial help, experts said. The country had set the target in January 2018 that would have increased the renewable energy capacity to 43% of its current energy mix.

263.title: CUET-UG postponed for 11,000 Phase-4 candidates from August 17-20 to August 30
263.article_body: The University Grants Commission (UGC) has said that CUET-UG for 11,000 out of the 3.72 lakh candidates who were scheduled to appear in the fourth phase has been postponed. Their exam has been postponed from August 17-20 to August 30 to accommodate their choice of city for exam centre, UGC Chairman Jagadesh Kumar said.

264.title: Man, his father assault his wife over dowry in Noida; arrested
264.article_body: A man and his father were arrested for allegedly assaulting his wife and three of her family members over dowry in Noida, the police said on Friday. The assault had occurred during an argument while the woman's family was visiting, the SHO said. A case has also been filed against the woman's brother-in-law, who is absconding, the police added.

265.title: Woman kills 5-yr-old daughter, dumps her body near Golden Temple; CCTV footage surfaces
265.article_body: A woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her five-year-old daughter and dumping her body near Golden Temple in Punjab's Amritsar. CCTV footage showed the woman carrying the girl. Police said that after dumping the girl's body, the woman approached a police station in Rajpura claiming her daughter had gone missing.

266.title: UP CM Yogi's pics defaced in hoardings in Firozabad; cases filed
266.article_body: Two cases have been filed after pictures of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found defaced in several 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' hoardings in Firozabad, officials said. While District Magistrate Ravi Ranjan said that Yogi's face was removed from three hoardings put up by the municipal body, a BJP leader claimed that the hoardings at six places were disfigured.

267.title: Misconception that a parallel Shiv Sena Bhavan is being made by Shinde camp: Maha minister
267.article_body: Maharashtra minister Uday Samant said there is a misconception that a parallel Shiv Sena Bhavan is being made by the Eknath Shinde faction in Dadar. "However, we're trying to find a central office so that the CM can meet common people," Samant tweeted. This comes amid Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's claim that his faction is the "real Shiv Sena".

268.title: Mass fish die-off in German-Polish river; cause unknown
268.article_body: Huge numbers of dead fish have washed up on the banks of the Oder River, which runs through Germany and Poland, in recent weeks. German and Polish authorities are working "flat-out" to establish the cause behind this "mass die-out and minimise potential further damage", German Environment Minister Steffi Lemke said. Officials have warned people not to enter the water.

269.title: Box office collection of Aamir's 'Laal...' drops by 40% on Day 2
269.article_body: The box office collection of Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' dropped by 40 percent on day two, after collecting approximately ₹7 crore, according to Box Office India. The film had earlier recorded Aamir's lowest opening in the last 13 years. Approximately 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have been reduced by exhibitors due to low turnout, reported Bollywood Hungama.

270.title: Govt lists ways to avoid incorrect display of the National Flag
270.article_body: Amid 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, the government has stated that the National Flag should not be displayed in an inverted manner and it shouldn't be damaged or disheveled. No other flag or bunting shall be placed higher than or above or side by side with the Tricolour. The flag shouldn't be allowed to touch the ground or trail in water.

271.title: 40-yr-old man accused in 8 cases of elephant poaching arrested in Odisha
271.article_body: Forest officials in Odisha have arrested a 40-year-old man accused in at least eight cases of elephant poaching. The accused used to illegally smuggle elephant tusks from Badamba area of Athagarh forest division to Kolkata, said Athagarh DFO Sudarshan Gopinath Yadav. This comes after the Environment Ministry sought a report from the state government regarding action taken against poachers.

272.title: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19 again
272.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi has tested positive for COVID-19, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said on Saturday. "She will remain in isolation as per government protocol," Ramesh tweeted. This comes after Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tested positive for COVID-19 on August 10. India reported 15,815 new COVID-19 cases in the past 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry.

273.title: Headless body of woman in her 20s found in drain in UP
273.article_body: A headless body of a woman, believed to be in her twenties, was found in the Lakkhipura area of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut district on Friday. Her body was first spotted by locals in a drain. Police said that teams have been formed to contact locals and collect details of any missing women in the area.

274.title: Man on his way to celebrate Rakhi dies after Chinese manjha slits his neck in Delhi
274.article_body: A 34-year-old man on his way to celebrate Raksha Bandhan was killed after a Chinese manjha (glass-coated string) slit his neck at Shastri Park flyover in Delhi on Thursday. Police said the deceased was on a motorcycle along with his wife and daughter at the time of the incident. The sale of Chinese manjha is banned in Delhi.

275.title: Narcotics worth ₹100 crore seized at Chennai airport; 1 arrested
275.article_body: Customs officials intercepted a passenger at the Chennai airport and seized narcotics, including heroin and cocaine, worth ₹100 crore from him, officials said on Friday. The man, who has been arrested, had hidden the narcotics in his check-in baggage and footwear, according to an official statement. The seized narcotics weighed a total of 9.59 kg, the official statement said.

276.title: Gunman kills 10 after family dispute in Montenegro
276.article_body: A gunman killed at least 10 people and injured six others in a shooting in Montenegro's Cetinje city on Friday following a family dispute. According to officials, the gunman shot dead three members of the same family who were staying at his house before randomly shooting passers-by. The gunman was later killed after firing at police, public broadcaster RTCG said.

277.title: Adani Group's acquisition of Ambuja Cements, ACC approved by CCI
277.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved Adani Group's acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC from Switzerland's Holcim. Adani Group had acquired the companies in May for ₹81,339 crore. The CCI gave the approval to Endeavour Trade and Investment, a company incorporated in Mauritius by the Adani Group. Adani Group is now the country's second-largest cement player after UltraTech.

278.title: Assam CM suspends 3 policemen after 13-yr-old girl found hanging
278.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma suspended three senior police officers from Darrang following allegations of dereliction of duty against them. This comes after a 13-year-old girl was allegedly found hanging inside a house in Dhula in June. Police allegedly displayed dereliction of duty in collecting evidence and an officer put pressure on the deceased's family to not file a complaint.

279.title: We're here to challenge really hard: Zimbabwe head coach on ODIs vs India
279.article_body: Zimbabwe head coach Dave Houghton said his team will look to challenge Team India "really hard" during the three-match ODI series, having defeated Bangladesh in the recently concluded T20I and ODI series. "We aren't here just to add up to...numbers...but...to challenge," added Houghton. "We're playing the strongest side in the world...I'd still expect us to...compete really well," he stated.

280.title: Free bus rides for women 'economic revolution' not 'freebie': TN CM
280.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday said free bus travel provided to women by the state government was an 'economic revolution' and shouldn't be categorised as 'freebies.' "Due to this scheme...families see 8-12% savings in their income which I would call...economic revolution," Stalin added. He noted that over 80% of beneficiaries were from backward classes and Adi Dravidar communities.

281.title: 31-year-old Bhojpuri singer arrested with 21 kg ganja in Delhi
281.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday said that they have arrested a 31-year-old singer-turned-drug peddler identified as Vinay Sharma with 21.5 kg ganja in the city. Sharma, who is a resident of Bihar's Siwan, has sung over 100 Bhojpuri songs, police stated. "Further efforts are going on to trace the source of the contraband," they added.

282.title: August rainfall helps major Pune dams reach full capacity: Report
282.article_body: Rainfall in the month of August has helped all major dams in Pune that supply drinking water to the city reach their full capacity, reported Indian Express. On Friday, Panshet dam remained at 99.27% capacity despite releasing water into Khadakwasla dam earlier, the report said. While Khadakwasla dam had reached 100% capacity on Wednesday following the discharge, the report added.

283.title: After declaring COVID victory, N Korea lifts mask mandate, other curbs
283.article_body: After North Korean leader Kim Jong-un declared victory over COVID-19 this week, North Korea has dropped a face mask mandate and other social distancing rules, state media reported on Saturday. The anti-epidemic measures were imposed in May after the country announced its first COVID-19 outbreak. North Korea had blamed the outbreak on "alien things" near its border with South Korea.

284.title: India will beat Pakistan and win the Asia Cup 2022: Ricky Ponting
284.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting said India will beat Pakistan in their Asia Cup match on August 28 in Dubai, adding that the former will go on to win the tournament as well. "India's depth is definitely better than the other teams," stated Ponting. Pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel have been ruled out of the Asia Cup.

285.title: What was the fatwa issued by Iran against Salman Rushdie in 1989?
285.article_body: In 1989, the then Iranian supreme leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini issued a fatwa against Salman Rushdie. Khomeini called for Rushdie to be killed for writing 'The Satanic Verses', which the cleric said insulted Islam. The British government had granted police protection to Rushdie after a $2.8-million bounty was put on the writer's head.

286.title: She liked her role: 'Puli' maker on Sridevi choosing it over 'Baahubali'
286.article_body: Talking about late actress Sridevi choosing his film 'Puli' over SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning', the film's director Chimbu Deven said, "She liked her role in 'Puli'." Rajamouli had earlier said they were "lucky" that Sridevi "rejected" the role, eventually played by Ramya Krishnan. "I was shocked and hurt...[It] made me feel very sad," Sridevi had reacted to Rajamouli's remark.

287.title: Questionable: Ex-selector Karim on India having 7 captains so far in 2022
287.article_body: With India having had seven captains so far in 2022, former selector Saba Karim said, "This kind of change in captaincy trend is strange and questionable." "Such decisions need to be taken very cautiously. There's no need to rush," added Karim. "It affects the morale of the cricketer," he stated. KL Rahul will lead India in the ODIs against Zimbabwe.

288.title: Noida woman kills husband as he finds out about her extra-marital affair
288.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly strangling her 30-year-old husband to death after he found out about her alleged extra-marital affair, Noida Police said. "The accused, in a fit of rage, strangled the deceased with her dupatta and bashed his head against the wall," police added. The deceased was married to the accused for 10 years, police further said.

289.title: RCP Singh was inducted into Union Cabinet without my consent: Bihar CM
289.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said that RCP Singh was inducted into the Union Cabinet without his consent. "He was the national chief and I did not approve of the development...I said in 2019 that we should get at least four berths...Agreeing to anything less than that would have sent a bad message," said Kumar.

290.title: Info Edge not in a hurry to sell Zomato, Policybazaar stakes: Founder
290.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani said on Friday that the company isn't in a "tearing hurry" to sell its stakes in Zomato and Policybazaar. Info Edge had sold shares worth ₹357 crore in Zomato's initial public offering while retaining a 15.3% stake. It hadn't sold any of its shares in Policybazaar parent PB Fintech's IPO and holds a 13.3% stake.

291.title: MoS Muraleedharan demands resignation of CPI(M) MLA over 'Azad Kashmir' remark
291.article_body: Union Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan criticised CPI(M) MLA KT Jaleel over his "Azad Kashmir" remark. "An elected MLA of Kerala saying that the Kashmir which is part of India, is an Indian occupied Kashmir and describing the Kashmir which has been occupied by Pakistan as Azad Kashmir. It is nothing less than treason," Muraleedharan said.

292.title: Entire police staff at Rohtak check post suspended for not filing FIR
292.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij on Friday ordered the suspension of the entire police staff at Rohtak's Sukhpura check post for negligence after an advocate accused the police personnel of not registering an FIR. "When I reached...check post...staff was under...influence of alcohol and they didn't lodge my complaint," the advocate claimed. Vij was chairing a grievances redressal committee meeting.

293.title: Absconding brother-in-law of Rajasthan BJP MLA arrested in murder case
293.article_body: A local Rajasthan MLA Shobharani Kushwah's brother-in-law and another man, both of who were absconding for a decade in a murder case, have been arrested, police said. The two were arrested from Sepau bypass crossing, Dholpur SP Dharmendra Singh added. The case pertains to the murder of a man who was shot dead on December 27, 2012, in Dholpur.

294.title: Nigerian national arrested with 30 grams of MDMA in Hyderabad
294.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW), along with Narayanguda police, on Friday arrested a Nigerian national for peddling drugs. Police also seized 30 grams of MDMA, ₹4,000 cash and four cell phones, all worth ₹3 lakh. The accused was illegally residing in Hyderabad, police said, adding that 108 consumers, who were purchasing drugs from the accused, have been identified.

295.title: EU should not be a supermarket for rich Russians: Ukraine Prez
295.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged European Union states to ban visas for Russian nationals. "Europe must...not be transformed into a supermarket where it's not important who walks in and where the main thing is that people just pay for their goods," he added. Zelenskyy said his proposal didn't apply to Russians who needed help from the "civilised world".

296.title: Pujara smashes 22 runs off 1 over, slams hundred off 73 deliveries in one-day match
296.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 22 runs off one over while playing for Sussex against Warwickshire in a Royal London One-Day Cup match and reached his hundred off 73 deliveries in the match. Pujara slammed three fours, two doubles and a six off Warwickshire pacer Liam Norwell in the 45th over. Pujara scored 107 runs off 79 deliveries.

297.title: YouTube working to launch streaming video services: Report
297.article_body: YouTube is planning to launch an online store for streaming video services, The Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. The report mentioned that the company has been working on the same for about 18 months now and has renewed talks with entertainment companies for participation. This will let YouTube join companies such as Roku and Apple in the streaming market.

298.title: Flying umbrella pierces woman's chest at US beach; police say 'Winds threw it into her'
298.article_body: A woman was killed after a flying beach umbrella pierced her chest in South Carolina, authorities said. The umbrella was blown from its anchoring by the wind, with police saying it was "thrown into the victim". The US Consumer Product Safety Commission estimates about 3,000 people are injured by beach umbrellas every year.

299.title: 1 dead, 9 injured as lightning strikes zinc plant in Rajasthan
299.article_body: One man was burnt to death and nine others were seriously injured after an acid tank exploded due to lightning at Hindustan Zinc plant in Rajasthan on Friday. The incident occurred in Chittorgarh district following which ten employees suffered burn injuries. They were rushed to district hospital where one of them died during treatment, Additional SP Kailash Singh Sandhu said.

300.title: BJP won 140 out of 186 seats in Goa Panchayat elections: CM Sawant
300.article_body: BJP has won over 140 seats out of 186 seats in the Goa Panchayat elections, state CM Pramod Sawant said on Friday. The state BJP President Sadanand Shet Tanavade told ANI that this is the "first time" in Goa Panchayat elections that "any party has won so many seats". Goa had reported a 78.7% voter turnout in the Panchayat elections.

301.title: Utterly horrified: Tharoor after author Salman Rushdie stabbed on stage in US
301.article_body: After India-born author Salman Rushdie was stabbed multiple times on stage in New York, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted that he's "utterly horrified and shocked" by the incident. "With a sinking heart, I recognize that life for him can never be the same again. A sad day, worse if creative expression can no longer be free & open," Tharoor wrote.

302.title: People walked out of my debut film 'Josh', it 'scarred' me: Naga
302.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who features in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said people "walked" out of his debut film 'Josh' which hit him "hard", adding that it "scarred" him. "A lot of people go for the first day. I can't because I am a wreck. I have severe anxiety problems on the day the film is releasing," added Naga.

303.title: 6 more bodies recovered after boat capsizes in UP's Banda; death toll reaches 9
303.article_body: At least six more bodies have been recovered from Kishanpur ghat in Uttar Pradesh's Banda after a boat capsized in the Yamuna on Thursday. A total of nine bodies have been recovered so far. The boat capsized due to strong winds, the Superintendent of Police said. CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed.

304.title: India reports 15,815 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,19,264
304.article_body: India has reported 15,815 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,561 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,19,264, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,996, according to the latest data.

305.title: Mangaluru school asks students to remove 'rakhis'; apologises after protests
305.article_body: A Christian missionary school in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly asked its students to remove 'rakhis' claiming that 'jewellery' was not allowed in the school. It later issued an apology following protests by the parents of at least 20 students. "We uphold the values of all religions. The incident was a mistake by some of our staff members," the school's in-charge said.

306.title: Ratan Tata receives Tricolour under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign; govt shares pic
306.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the National Flag ahead of the Independence Day under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The government also shared a picture of the flag being presented to the industrialist. Under the campaign, people have been urged to hoist or display the National Flag at their homes between August 13 and 15.

307.title: Paraguay Vice Prez Velazquez to resign after US sanctions
307.article_body: Paraguayan Vice President Hugo Velazquez on Friday said he would resign next week and withdraw his candidacy for the presidency after he was sanctioned by the US for "significant corruption". Velazquez denied the US allegations and insisted he has "a clear conscience". Velazquez, who is barred from entering the US, said his resignation would be offered to "protect" his party.

308.title: Who are the Ballon d'Or nominees as Messi not included for 1st time since 2005?
308.article_body: Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi hasn't been nominated for Ballon d'Or 2022. It's the first time since 2005 that Messi has not made it to the 30-man shortlist for the award. Meanwhile, Cristiano Ronaldo is on the Ballon d'Or shortlist for the 18th year in a row. Other nominees include Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland, among others.

309.title: I only want to work for people like him: Employee fired by CEO who posted crying selfie
309.article_body: After HyperSocial's CEO Braden Wallake's crying selfie went viral, an employee who was laid off by him said he's only interested in working for people like Wallake. Noah Smith was told that the company didn't have funds to continue employing him. "I was a bit shocked, but didn't feel any immediate rush of anger or resentment," Smith wrote on LinkedIn.

310.title: India's industrial output grows 12.3% in June: Govt data
310.article_body: India’s industrial output, measured through the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a 12.3% growth in June, data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation showed on Friday. The manufacturing and electricity sectors led the growth. IIP growth in June 2021 was 13.8%. The industrial growth in the April-June period of the current fiscal rose by 12.7%.

311.title: Businessman's ₹193-cr superyacht with 5 rooms, pool bursts into flames in Spain
311.article_body: A superyacht worth around £20 million (₹193 crore) belonging to Italian businessman Paolo Scudieri went up in flames near Formentera island in Spain. All five bedrooms, gym and swimming pool in the yacht named Aria SF are said to be destroyed after the fire. Emergency services said nine passengers and seven crew were rescued from the Aria SF.

312.title: Arsenal's Granit Xhaka picks winning Champions League over World Cup
312.article_body: Arsenal midfielder and Switzerland captain Granit Xhaka picked winning the Champions League over winning the World Cup during an interview. Xhaka further chose to finish in the top four of the Premier League, which ensures Champions League qualification in comparison to winning the FA Cup. Xhaka named Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

313.title: I was very frustrated: Fàbregas on throwing pizza at Sir Alex in 2004
313.article_body: Recollecting Arsenal's 0-2 defeat against Manchester United in October 2004, which ended his team's 49-game unbeaten run, ex-Arsenal midfielder Cesc Fàbregas said, "I was very frustrated." "We started hearing noises...I didn't have the...courage maybe to go into that fight. They were monsters in there...I threw a slice of pizza and...it hit [United manager] Sir Alex Ferguson," he added.

314.title: 72-year-old man jumps in front of metro train in Gurugram, dies
314.article_body: A 72-year-old man died after he jumped in front of an approaching train at the Guru Dronacharya Metro Station in Gurugram on Friday, police said. The police added that a suicide note was found in the deceased's pocket. "The man didn't blame anyone in...suicide note for his extreme step," a station house officer said. The incident occurred at 4.56 pm.

315.title: Bajaj Group gives 5 lakh National Flags to PMC for free distribution
315.article_body: Bajaj Group has handed over five lakh National Flags to the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for free distribution. This comes as the civic body decided to distribute flags for free to every household in the city to ensure flag hoisting under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' initiative. "Bajaj family is a family of freedom fighters," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

316.title: Top secret files found at Trump's home; ex-US Prez suspected of violating Espionage Act
316.article_body: The FBI seized top secret files in a search of former US President Donald Trump's estate in Florida this week, according to a search warrant. The warrant indicates that FBI agents were looking into potential violations of the Espionage Act, which makes it illegal to keep or transmit potentially dangerous national security information. Agents removed 11 sets of documents.

317.title: 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days: Punjab CM Mann
317.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said that 6,000 posts of Anganwadi workers will be filled in 45 days. The entire recruitment will be merit-based and no bribe and recommendation will work, he added. As many as 4,300 Punjab Police posts are being filled and appointment letters would be given to those selected in the coming days, Mann stated.

318.title: British PM, French Prez condemn 'cowardly' attack on Salman Rushdie
318.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in New York, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "For 33 years...Rushdie has embodied freedom and the fight against obscurantism. He has just been the victim of a cowardly attack by the forces of hatred and barbarism...We stand by his side." UK PM Boris Johnson said he was "appalled" by the attack.

319.title: 'Laal...' isn't Aamir's biopic: Mona on criticism over playing his mother
319.article_body: Reacting to criticism over playing Aamir Khan's mother in 'Laal Singh Chaddha' at the age of 40 with Aamir 57 years old, actress Mona Singh said, "It is not...Aamir's...biopic...That would be wrong." "I was so confident...that most people won't question the age gap after seeing the film," added Mona. "What's the logic...This is wrong," Aamir had responded to the criticism.

320.title: Karnataka reports 2,032 new COVID-19 cases, 1,202 from B'luru alone
320.article_body: Karnataka reported 2,032 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Friday, out of which 1,202 cases were recorded in Bengaluru alone. According to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath, no deaths were reported in the city on Friday. With 7,102 active COVID-19 cases, the test positivity rate in Bengaluru now stands at 6.94%, data showed.

321.title: I am a Chinese, not a terrorist: Huawei India CEO reportedly tells Delhi court
321.article_body: Huawei India's CEO Li Xiongwei told a Delhi court, "I am a Chinese (national) and not a terrorist," in response to the Income Tax Department's opposition to his bail plea, the ET reported. India doesn't have an extradition treaty with China and if Xiongwei leaves, it would be tough to bring him back for trial, the Department told the court.

322.title: 2 persons from Mumbai held in Pune with mephedrone worth ₹7.56 lakh
322.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Pune City Police's crime branch arrested two residents of Mumbai with 54 grams of mephedrone (MD) worth ₹7.56 lakh near Khadi Machine Chowk in Kondhwa. Police acted on a tip-off and laid a trap to arrest the suspected drug peddlers. After the operation, police also recovered cell phones and some cash from the accused.

323.title: Drunk air hostess, friends create ruckus at restaurant, break car's windshield in Jaipur
323.article_body: A drunk air hostess and her three friends allegedly created a ruckus at a Jaipur restaurant after getting into an argument with a family, police said. She also allegedly broke the windshield of the car belonging to the family with a beer bottle. Police said the air hostess and five others were arrested in connection with the case.

324.title: India-China relationship can't be normal as border situation is not normal: Govt
324.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Friday said, "We have maintained our position that if China disturbs the peace and tranquillity in border areas, it will impact our relations." "Our relationship is not normal, it cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal," he further said.

325.title: Hyd Traffic Police issues advisory ahead of tricoloured balloons programme
325.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory ahead of the release of tricoloured balloons at Upper Tankbund on Saturday. According to the advisory, from 9:30 am to 12:30 pm, traffic from Liberty towards Upper Tankbund will be diverted at Ambedkar statue towards Telugu Thalli, Iqbal Minar. Parking places have also been notified in the advisory.

326.title: 34-yr-old dies as throat slit by kite string while riding bike in Delhi
326.article_body: A 34-year-old man died after his throat was slit by glass-coated kite string ('manjha') in Delhi's Shastri Park area on Friday, police said. The man was with his wife and their eight-year-old daughter when the accident happened, police added. "The driver of an ambulance which was passing by stopped and took the family to the hospital," the deceased's nephew said.

327.title: 53-year-old Anne Heche declared legally dead days after car crash, family confirms
327.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who had been in a coma since a car crash in Los Angeles last week, has been declared legally dead, her family confirmed. Her representative said that she is legally dead according to California law, but she is still on life support as medical professionals are assessing if any of her organs can be donated.

328.title: Bear possibly hallucinating after being high on 'mad honey' rescued in Turkey
328.article_body: A bear cub believed to be high on 'mad honey' and possibly hallucinating was rescued in Turkey after being found in a forest. The disoriented bear was captured on camera wobbling and whining in the back of a pickup truck after being rescued. Mad honey is a type of rhododendron honey that can have hallucinogenic effects.

329.title: 24-yr-old who attacked Salman Rushdie onstage in NY identified as Hadi Matar
329.article_body: A 24-year-old man named Hadi Matar has been taken into custody after he stabbed 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie onstage in New York. Matar, who is from New Jersey, stabbed Rushdie at least once in the neck and the stomach, Major Eugene Staniszewski of New York State Police said. A motive for Matar's alleged attack hasn't been determined yet.

330.title: Author Salman Rushdie on ventilator, could lose eye after being stabbed: Agent
330.article_body: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie is on ventilator after he was stabbed in the abdomen and the neck onstage in New York. "The news is not good...Salman will likely lose one eye; the nerves in his arm were severed; and his liver was stabbed and damaged," Rushdie's agent said. The interviewer onstage was also attacked and suffered facial injury.

331.title: Students understood JNU not for anti-national activities: Chancellor
331.article_body: JNU students have realised that it is not a place for activities that are anti-national or against the interest of the nation's sovereignty, said chancellor VK Saraswat. "At times, there was a clash of ideologies, that is why you used to hear that there are problems," he added. Violent clashes have broken out inside the campus in recent years.

332.title: Advocate who beat constable in Anand Vihar police station gets bail
332.article_body: An advocate who allegedly beat up a police constable has been granted bail by a Delhi court on Friday. The court said there was no need for custodial interrogation and added that the accused had belittled the institution of the bar. The Head Constable was allegedly beaten by a group of people inside Anand Vihar police station on July 31.

333.title: There was a pool of blood around Rushdie, people were saying 'He has a pulse': Eyewitness
333.article_body: Rita Landman, an endocrinologist who was in audience when author Salman Rushdie was attacked on a stage in New York, said there was a pool of blood around him. Landman, who walked on stage to offer assistance, added he appeared to be alive and wasn't receiving CPR. "People were saying, 'He has a pulse, he has a pulse'," she stated.

334.title: LinkedIn user's post on specially-abled B'luru Swiggy delivery man goes viral
334.article_body: In a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Bengaluru resident shared a picture of a specially-abled Swiggy delivery man. Rohit Kumar said he had got impatient over his delayed order but felt "stupid" when the delivery man arrived. "[He was] graciously smiling at me...[and] trying to balance himself with crutches...I [felt] stupid [for getting] impatient sitting on my comfortable bed," Rohit said.

335.title: Asia Cup game against India just like any other match: Babar Azam
335.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said that they would approach their first game of the Asia Cup 2022 against India as any other match. He said the team will play the tournament by focusing on their game and believing in their abilities. "Putting our best effort is in our hands, but results are not," said the top-order batsman.

336.title: Ridiculous: BJP on rumours about replacing Karnataka CM Bommai
336.article_body: BJP National General Secretary in charge of Karnataka Arun Singh on Friday said speculation on replacing Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai was "ridiculous", saying "these are tricks of Congress". He asserted that BJP will contest the 2023 Karnataka assembly polls under Bommai's leadership. He said Congress was trying to create confusion as there was infighting among Congress members.

337.title: UK officially declares drought in large parts of England
337.article_body: Large parts of England were officially declared drought-hit on Friday, amid prolonged heatwave conditions in the country. The affected regions include all of east England and parts of south and central England. "We are currently experiencing a second heatwave after what was the driest July on record for parts of the country," said UK Water Minister Steve Double.

338.title: Timely slap to BJP: Tejashwi on Nitish Kumar quitting NDA alliance
338.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav said JDU chief Nitish Kumar's decision to break away from the NDA alliance was "a timely slap to BJP". Yadav was speaking to the media after stepping out from meeting Congress President Sonia Gandhi in Delhi. The new RJD-JDU alliance is set to undergo a floor test to prove its majority on August 24.

339.title: First Africa-bound UN grain ship arrives in Ukraine since invasion
339.article_body: The first Africa-bound United Nations-chartered grain ship since Russia's invasion of Ukraine docked in Pivdennyi port on Friday, Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said on Friday. The ship was hired to carry Ukrainian grain to famine-stricken parts of the Horn of Africa, where 18 million people face severe hunger. The war had halted grain exports from Ukraine.

340.title: Kerala MLA KT Jaleel calls PoK 'Azad Kashmir', BJP criticises him
340.article_body: CPI(M)-backed independent Kerala MLA KT Jaleel called Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) "Azad Kashmir" in a Facebook post, after his visit to Srinagar. He also criticised the Centre's decision to abrogate Article 370 and said, "The special status was taken away without their consent". The BJP has reacted by calling Jaleel "anti-India" and asked for him to be booked for sedition.

341.title: Delhi reports 10 deaths due to COVID-19, logs 2,136 fresh cases
341.article_body: Delhi recorded 10 fatalities due to COVID-19 on Friday, the highest in six months, as per data released by the health department. According to the data, the national capital also logged 2,136 fresh cases of the infection with a positivity rate of 15.02%. On Thursday, Delhi had reported 2,726 cases, the highest single-day spike in daily caseload in six-and-a-half months.

342.title: Will lead to a revolution: Harsha Bhogle on window for women's IPL
342.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has said that a dedicated window in the sporting calendar for women's IPL will "lead to a revolution" in the women's game in India. This comes as reports claimed that the BCCI is likely to schedule a women's IPL in March 2023. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said the event would be a "priority" for them.

343.title: NIA arrests 10th accused in Umesh Kolhe murder case
343.article_body: The NIA on Friday arrested 28-year-old Shaikh Shakeel for his alleged involvement in the murder of pharmacist Umesh Kolhe in Maharashtra's Amravati. During investigation, Shakeel's "active role" in the murder conspiracy came to light, the agency said. Shakeel is the tenth accused to be arrested in the case. Kolhe was allegedly murdered for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

344.title: ED attaches assets worth over ₹300 crore of Bengaluru's Mantri Developers
344.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has attached immovable assets worth over ₹300 crore as part of its ongoing money laundering probe against Bengaluru-based real estate group Mantri Developers. The private firm is alleged to have cheated several home buyers, officials said. Notably, the home buyers' money was given to the developers but had been allegedly "diverted" for non-construction activities.

345.title: Man from minority Ahmadi community stabbed to death in Pakistan
345.article_body: A 62-year-old man belonging to Pakistan's minority Ahmadi community was stabbed to death in Rabwah town on Friday allegedly for refusing to chant Islamist slogans. "The accused approached Naseer Ahmad...and asked him to raise slogans of an Islamist party," a spokesman for the minority group said. "On Ahmad's refusal, he repeatedly stabbed and killed him on spot," the spokesman added.

346.title: VVS Laxman to be India's acting head coach for Zimbabwe ODI series
346.article_body: Former cricketer VVS Laxman will be the acting head coach of the Indian team for the next week's ODI series in Zimbabwe. "Yes, Laxman will be in charge...It's not like Rahul Dravid is taking a break," BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said. He added, "[But Dravid is absent because] there is little gap between the Asia Cup and Zimbabwe series."

347.title: Kejriwal a 'lie minister', creating fear among masses: Anurag Thakur
347.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Friday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of "creating fear" among the masses regarding Centre's finances and called him a "lie minister". Kejriwal has alleged that the BJP-led Centre lacks funds to support social welfare schemes as it has waived loans and taxes worth crores of rupees of its "super-rich friends".

348.title: Pavan Varma quits Trinamool Congress months after joining it
348.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Pavan Varma quit Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Friday, months after joining the party.
