Varma had joined TMC after being sacked from JD(U) due to his stand on Citizenship Amendment Act. His resignation comes after JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar broke ties with BJP and joined hands with Rashtriya Janata Dal to form the Mahagathbandhan government in Bihar.

349.title: India's relationship with China is not normal: S Jaishankar
349.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said that the relationship between India and China "cannot be normal as the border situation is not normal". While speaking at an event, the minister said that if China disturbed the peace in border areas, it would impact relations. He added that the Indian military has been holding its ground at the border.

350.title: EU proposal on nuclear deal acceptable if assurances provided: Iran
350.article_body: EU's proposal for revival of the 2015 nuclear deal can be acceptable if it provides Iran with "assurance on...safeguards, sanctions and guarantees," Iranian state media reported citing a senior diplomat on Friday. The EU on Monday said it had submitted its "final text" for revival of the pact as indirect talks between Iran and the US regarding the issue concluded.

351.title: Raju Srivastava's family issues statement, says 'his condition is stable'
351.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava's family has issued a statement saying his condition is stable. "We are praying for his speedy recovery. The doctors are treating him and are doing their best...Please ignore any rumours/ fake news being circulated," the statement read. The comedian was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS after he suffered a heart attack on Wednesday.

352.title: Liverpool's Joel Matip injured ahead of Palace clash: Report
352.article_body: Liverpool defender Joel Matip reportedly sat out Friday's training session due to a groin problem. With the club's first-choice central defender Ibrahima Konate injured, Matip played in the opening match of the Premier League 2022-23 against Fulham. The reported injury may affect Matip's availability for the match against Crystal Palace on August 15.

353.title: Raju Srivastava moved his fingers & shoulders, your prayers are working: Suman
353.article_body: Sharing a health update about comedian Raju Srivastava who was hospitalised following a heart attack, Shekhar Suman tweeted, "Good news, Raju moved his fingers and shoulders." "Things looking slightly positive according to the doctors. Your prayers are working," he added. Earlier in the day, Shekhar tweeted, "Raju hasn't regained consciousness in...last 46 hours...pray hard for his recovery."

354.title: Videos by neighbour compared me to Babar, Aurangzeb: Salman in defamation trial
354.article_body: In the defamation case filed by actor Salman Khan against his neighbour Ketan Kakkad and others, Salman said that the videos uploaded by Kakkad, "communally provoked the viewers against" him. Kakkad compared Salman to Babar and Aurangzeb in a video and said he was "trying to shut down a Ganesh temple", the actor's counsel told the Bombay High Court.

355.title: No Indian player can play or mentor any team in overseas T20 leagues: BCCI
355.article_body: With several IPL franchises buying teams in foreign T20 leagues, the BCCI said that no Indian player can take part in any other league until he is retired from all forms of the game. "If any player wants to take part in these upcoming leagues he can only do so when he cuts off all ties with...BCCI," the BCCI stated.

356.title: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage, is alive: NY Governor
356.article_body: Author Salman Rushdie, who was stabbed on stage as he was about to give a lecture, is alive and has been airlifted to safety, said New York Governor Kathy Hochul. The author is getting the care he needs at a local hospital, she added. The incident took place at Chautauqua Institution in New York.

357.title: Will work harder, score more runs: Ishan on missing out from Asia Cup squad
357.article_body: After not being named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said that he will "work harder and score more runs". "I feel that what selectors do is fair. They put a lot of thought while selecting players," Kishan said. Notably, the 24-year-old cricketer is India's second highest run-scorer in T20Is this year.

358.title: 9 yrs on, we have a very strong bond: Dhawan on friendship with Rohit
358.article_body: Indian batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he shares a "very strong bond and friendship" with skipper Rohit Sharma. "Nine years on...we've come to understand each other's game...we are always looking to support each other," Dhawan said. He added, "Rohit has been a fantastic opening partner and to have a milestone that I share with Rohit is a happy feeling."

359.title: Gang violence in Mexico's Ciudad Juárez leaves 11 dead
359.article_body: Mexican security officials on Friday said a gang riot inside a border prison that left two inmates dead quickly spread to the streets of Ciudad Juárez where alleged gang members killed nine more people. "They attacked the civilian, innocent population like a sort of revenge," Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said. About 20 others were injured in the violence.

360.title: Aamir faces complaint for allegedly disrespecting Indian Army in Laal Singh Chaddha
360.article_body: A complaint has been filed against Aamir Khan and 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for allegedly disrespecting the Indian Army and hurting Hindu sentiments. A Delhi-based lawyer, in his complaint, stated, "The makers have depicted that a mentally challenged person was allowed to join Army." He also alleged that a scene in the movie caused "enraged emotions among the Hindu religion followers".

361.title: World javelin champion Peters beaten up on boat, thrown into water; video surfaces
361.article_body: Grenadian javelin thrower Anderson Peters, who recently won gold in World Athletics Championships, was beaten up and thrown off a boat in his native country. A video has surfaced online showing a group of men beating him on the boat called 'Harbour Master'. Peters was later thrown into the water. He reportedly suffered minor injuries in the incident.

362.title: Free entry to Taj Mahal premises from August 13-15: ASI
362.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) announced on Friday that entry to the premises of Taj Mahal will remain free and accessible for all visitors from August 13-15. However, the main mausoleum has been exempted from this provision in order to effectively manage the visitors, ASI added. Earlier, Union Culture Ministry announced free entry to all ASI-protected monuments from August 5-15.

363.title: Fan asks why shooter Abhinav Bindra retired too early, Bindra responds
363.article_body: Reacting to a Twitter post about the 14th anniversary of shooter Abhinav Bindra's Olympic gold medal-winning moment, a fan asked why he retired too early. Bindra responded, "1) Recognised my fading skills 2) Failed in two successive [Olympic] Games 3) Was...appropriate time to give my spot to...younger athlete and talent! (did not just want to hold on to it)."

364.title: China and Nepal agree to build trans-Himalayan rail network
364.article_body: The Chinese Foreign Ministry said that China and Nepal have agreed to build the so-called Trans-Himalayan Multi-Dimensional Connectivity Network under China's Belt and Road Initiative. China would finance the feasibility study of a cross-border railway and send experts to Nepal to conduct surveys this year, it added. The network will involve the building of railways and communication networks.

365.title: Akshay is family, started tying rakhi to him almost 30 yrs ago: Rupali
365.article_body: Rupali Ganguly, in an episode of 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar', spoke about her bond with Akshay Kumar and said, "Akshay is family to us." She revealed she started tying rakhi to him almost 30 years ago. Rupali further said Akshay became very close to her because of her father, who had given film to the actor in his early days.

366.title: Red Bull F1 boss says he looks up to Alex Ferguson in dealing with criticism
366.article_body: Red Bull F1 chief Christian Horner has said that he looks up to former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson when he has to deal with criticism. "I doubt he ever worried about what perception other managers or people thought about him," said Horner about the now-retired manager. He was responding to questions about his aggressive style and nature of management.

367.title: School bus falls off road in Himachal Pradesh; 12 students injured
367.article_body: As many as 12 students of SSRVM Senior Secondary School were injured after their bus fell 20-30 m from the road. The incident took place near Lamlehri Upperli bend in Una. All the students on the bus were rescued and taken to a regional hospital in Una. The condition of three of the injured students is serious, an official said.

368.title: Boy barred from giving Guj class 12 board exams for bribing examiner
368.article_body: A class 12 student has been debarred from giving the Gujarat board examinations for a year, as he allegedly tried to bribe an examiner, an official said on Friday. The science stream student is accused of attaching a ₹500 note to his answer sheet in this year's examinations. The boy is among 22 science stream students who faced disciplinary action.

369.title: 24 Pakistani refugees get Indian citizenship in Gujarat's Rajkot
369.article_body: At least 24 refugees, mostly Hindus, from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by authorities in Gujarat's Rajkot on Friday, an official said. Gujarat Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi handed over citizenship certificates to them, an official release stated. "My family has been waiting for...16 years to get Indian citizenship," a youngster pursuing career in aviation sector said.

370.title: Glad TN got 5th elephant reserve in Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai: Stalin
370.article_body: On World Elephant Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said he was glad the state got its fifth elephant reserve at Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai. "Elephants play a critical role in balancing...forest ecosystems," he tweeted. This comes after the Union Environment Ministry made an announcement accepting a proposal of the state forest department to notify the land as an elephant reserve.

371.title: Karnataka Cabinet passes aerospace and defence policy
371.article_body: The Karnataka Cabinet on Friday passed the 'Karnataka Aerospace and Defence Policy 2022-27' which aims to attract ₹45,000 crore investment. It offers incentives to manufacturing units and companies in the sector. "The aim is to make Karnataka a hub in aerospace and defence sectors. We want to strengthen the state's position...and encourage exports," Minister JC Madhuswamy said.

372.title: In touch with family: MEA after Indian-origin woman's suicide in US
372.article_body: Days after Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, India's External Affairs Ministry on Friday informed that the Indian Consulate in New York is in touch with the family and local authorities. "Our embassy in Washington is in contact with the US authorities, who assured us of appropriate action," MEA Spokesperson said.

373.title: Terrible day for literature: Dalrymple on attack on Salman Rushdie
373.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in the US on Friday, historian William Dalrymple tweeted, "A terrible day for literature, for freedom of speech and for authors everywhere." "Poor poor Salman: I pray he's not hurt and recovers quickly," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was attacked as he was about to give a lecture.

374.title: Andhra govt bans 'derogatory and abusive' slang for Nayee Brahmins
374.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has banned the use of a few words in the local slang that are derogatory to the Nayee Brahmin community. "Any person using such abusive and prohibited words...shall be liable for action under the...Indian Penal Code," the order said. The new rule was brought in based on recommendations of the Backward Classes Welfare Department.

375.title: Boris Johnson has not returned my calls: Rishi Sunak
375.article_body: Britain's prime ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said Prime Minister Boris Johnson has not returned his calls since he resigned from the UK Cabinet as Chancellor last month. Speaking to 'The Daily Telegraph', Sunak said, "I have messaged and called but, unsurprisingly, he hasn't returned my calls." Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are contesting to become Britain's next Prime Minister.

376.title: 5 Chinese state-owned companies to delist from New York Stock Exchange amid US tensions
376.article_body: Five Chinese state-owned companies would delist from the New York Stock Exchange amid economic and diplomatic tensions with the United States. They include China Life Insurance, PetroChina, China Petroleum & Chemical, Aluminum Corporation of China Limited and Sinopec Shanghai Petrochemical. The five companies were flagged by the US securities regulator as failing to meet its auditing standards.

377.title: Kareena wishes Sara Ali Khan on her b'day, shares throwback pic
377.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to wish Sara Ali Khan on her birthday. Sharing a childhood picture of Sara with Saif Ali Khan, she wrote, "Happy Birthday darling Sara. Unlimited pizza and cakes for you today." Sara is the daughter of Saif from his first wife, Amrita Singh. Sara turned 27 on Friday.

378.title: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav gets Z+ security cover, bulletproof car
378.article_body: The Bihar government on Friday granted Z+ security cover and a bulletproof car to Tejashwi Yadav, who took oath as the new Deputy Chief Minister of the state. According to an official, a circular to this effect was issued on Thursday and commandos of the Bihar Special Armed Police (BSAP) would be involved in the security of the RJD leader.

379.title: Rushdie suffered apparent stab wound to neck, his condition not known yet: NY Police
379.article_body: New York State Police have issued a statement in regard to the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "On August 12...at about 11 am, a male suspect ran up onto the stage and attacked Rushdie," the statement read. "Rushdie suffered an apparent stab wound to the neck, and was transported by helicopter to...[a]...hospital. His condition is not yet known," it added.

380.title: Police stop 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader in Bengal
380.article_body: Police stopped a 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari in West Bengal's Nandigram on Friday. They said the leader only had permission for 'padyatra', not bike journey. "A procession to campaign for hoisting the Indian National Flag is being prohibited...Does the [West Bengal] Administration feel that the state isn't a part of India?" Adhikari tweeted.

381.title: Over 2,500 houses destroyed in Sudan floods
381.article_body: Seasonal rains and floods have destroyed over 2,500 houses in east Sudan, leaving thousands homeless in what is an already impoverished region. The nationwide death toll from the rains is still undetermined. Since the monsoon season began in May, about 38,000 people have been affected by floods in Sudan, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said.

382.title: ED freezes assets worth ₹370 crore of crypto exchange Vauld's India entity
382.article_body: The ED has frozen assets worth ₹370 crore of Flipvolt Technologies, the Indian entity of crypto exchange Vauld, in a money laundering case. "Lax KYC norms, loose regulatory control of allowing transfers to foreign wallets without asking any reason, non-recording of transactions on blockchains to save costs...has ensured...Flipvolt isn't able to give any account for missing crypto assets," ED said.

383.title: I love my boys but I wanted a daughter: Shefali Shah
383.article_body: Shefali Shah, who shares two sons with her filmmaker-husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah, said she wanted to have a daughter in both of her pregnancies. "I wanted a daughter. I love my boys, but I wanted a daughter, both...times," she said. Shefali was most recently seen in 'Darlings', in which she played a mother to Badrunissa Sheikh, played by Alia Bhatt.

384.title: This year's last Supermoon seen in skies across the world, pics surface
384.article_body: This year's third and last Supermoon has been spotted in night skies across the world, with pictures of the natural phenomenon being shared online. Referred to as the Sturgeon Moon, the Supermoon reached its zenith in the early hours of Friday morning. It appeared bigger than normal with orange hues.

385.title: Russian officials trained in Iran as part of drone deal: US
385.article_body: Russian officials received training in Iran over recent weeks as part of the agreement for transfer of drones from Iran to Russia, the US State Department said on Thursday. Last month, Washington said it had information that suggested Iran was preparing to provide Russia with up to a several hundred drones, including some "weapons-capable" ones, amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

386.title: China sanctions Lithuanian deputy minister over her Taiwan visit
386.article_body: China on Friday said that it has sanctioned Lithuania's Deputy Transport and Communications Minister, Agne Vaiciukeviciute, over her visit to Taiwan. China's foreign ministry said that all engagements between Beijing and Vaiciukeviciute's ministry would also be suspended. Lithuania's Ministry of Transport and Communications said it had not received any official information regarding the matter.

387.title: Fossil of small armour-plated dinosaur discovered in Argentina
387.article_body: The remains of a small armoured dinosaur that lived about 100 million years ago were discovered in Argentina. It likely walked upright on its back legs and weighed as much as a pet cat. Named Jakapil kaniukura, the dinosaur would have been well-protected with rows of bony disk-shaped armour along its neck and back, down to its tail, researchers said.

388.title: When will we discuss loan waivers to big corporations?: Congress
388.article_body: Congress on Friday asked when there will be a discussion on loan waivers to big corporations. "When will there be a discussion on freebies given by the public sector banks of ₹5.8 lakh crore in the last five years?" Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh asked. These comments come in the wake of PM Narendra Modi's criticism of the culture of 'freebies'.

389.title: Shah Rukh Khan's reported look from 'Brahmāstra' leaked online, pics go viral
389.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's pictures, reportedly from 'Brahmāstra', were leaked online. The actor's first look as Vanarastra, inspired by Lord Hanuman, has gone viral on the internet. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I am getting goosebumps already" while another comment read, "This leaked footage is gold." "SRK’s presence...will make #Brahmāstra an even more exciting affair!" another Twitter user wrote.

390.title: Rare microscopic creatures discovered in Scottish caves
390.article_body: Researchers have discovered rare microscopic creatures, the tiny crustaceans named ostracods, in the Smoo Cave in Sutherland and Allt nan Uamh Stream Cave in Assynt. The creatures found are around one millimetre in size and were found residing in pools inside the caves. "Styglobitic creatures live entirely below the earth's surface," a researcher said.

391.title: RCB's official YouTube channel hacked, name changed to 'MicroStrategy'
391.article_body: The official YouTube channel of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) was hacked, with hackers changing the name of the channel to 'MicroStrategy'. The hackers also posted a video with thumbnail reading, "Event Now...Hurry Up!" The channel was later removed, with "This account has been terminated for violating YouTube's Community Guidelines" message being displayed on opening the channel.

392.title: Minister TS Singhdeo's relative found dead near Bilaspur railway track
392.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister and Congress leader TS Singhdeo's relative Bir Bhadra Pratap was found dead near a railway track in Bilaspur's Belghana, police said on Friday. Bir Bhadra, who was popularly known as Sachin Singh, died after allegedly falling from a train, ANI reported. Chhattisgarh Police said post-mortem examination has been done.

393.title: Around 250 people executed in Iran this year
393.article_body: Iran executed around 250 people since the beginning of this year, human rights organisation Amnesty International said in a recent report. The number of executions this year is twice as many as the same period last year in Iran, the report added. In 2021, Iran is estimated to have executed 314 people, the second-highest rate of executions per capita.

394.title: Suryakumar Yadav buys Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore, pic surfaces
394.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav bought a Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore ahead of Asia Cup 2022, which will begin in the UAE later this month. Earlier this year, Suryakumar had bought a Nissan 1 Ton Jonga. Suryakumar made his Team India debut in 2021 and has played 13 ODIs and 23 T20Is so far.

395.title: Jadeja has to prove his batting to replace Karthik, Pandya: Manjrekar
395.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's position in the India T20I team. "If Jadeja is going to be a batting all-rounder, then he has got to show that he is an adequate replacement to...Dinesh Karthik, who is likely to bat at number 6-7, or...Hardik Pandya," Manjrekar said.

396.title: Terrorists open fire at checkpoint in Kashmir, policeman injured
396.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at a security checkpoint in Anantnag, resulting in injuries to a Jammu and Kashmir policeman. The police have cordoned off the area and a search is underway for the attackers. The injured policeman, Ghulam Qadir, was immediately evacuated and is currently receiving treatment in a hospital, the Kashmir Police said in a tweet.

397.title: Valour of soldiers to be included in school textbooks: Education Minister
397.article_body: Tales of valour of Indian soldiers would soon be made part of the school textbooks, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, said. "To strengthen the sense of responsibility towards the nation from an early age, the education ministry in consultation with the defence ministry will work to include the valour of our soldiers into the school curriculum," he said.

398.title: Terrorism suspect blows himself up in Saudi Arabia, 4 injured
398.article_body: A terrorism suspect detonated an explosive device in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah on Wednesday as security forces attempted to arrest him, killing himself and injuring four others, state media reported on Friday. The man has been identified as Abdullah bin Zaid Abdulrahman Al-Bakry Al-Shihry. He was wanted in connection with a deadly 2015 bombing in the country.

399.title: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie attacked during lecture in US
399.article_body: India-born author of 'The Satanic Verses', Salman Rushdie, was attacked on Friday as he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution in New York, AP reported. A man stormed the stage Rushdie was on and punched or stabbed him during the author's introduction, AP said. Rushdie fell to the floor and his attacker was reportedly restrained.

400.title: Party will talk to Opposition to make Mamata PM candidate: TMC MP
400.article_body: Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, TMC MP Saugata Roy said his party will talk to others in the Opposition to make West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee a joint prime ministerial candidate. "Mamata Banerjee is leading in this. She's backed by this huge state," Roy said. "Our workers definitely want Mamata as the PM candidate," Roy added.
